Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie S
Reviews.Content: stayed here with 2 friends at beginning of april after seeing excellent reviews and it definately lives up to them! absolutely wonderful trip, we were treated like royalty by all the staff, beautiful reception/restaurant/breakfast area, room classic italian chic style & absolutely beautiful, oozed luxury. perfect location, right on the lagoon sea front with the gondolas and lots going on around it, seconds from piazza san marco and the shopping streets and around 15mins stunning slow walk from rialto bridge. restaurant expensive but EXCELLENT! well worth saving up and having a meal there. nothing was too much trouble for staff. whole place oozed luxury perfect location - GO HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Venice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynne K
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this fabulous hotel on our first trip to Venice for our 25th wedding anniversary. I had paid extra for a waterfront view and we were excited to find we had one of the few rooms with a balcony! I loved waking up at night and gazing out at the lagoon and grand canal. We spent a lot of time just sunning and people watching from our place on the 2nd floor, so much activity! Elegantly appointed room and to die for marble bathroom, plus we had several english tv channels when I wanted to check the weather or news, Excellent dinner and breakfast, the wait staff knew us after our first visit and never asked for our hotel room number but once. This hotel is right next to San Marco square and the Bridge of Sighs, easy to find our way back too after wandering the inner city maze of Venice! Miss it already!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: GratefulGauntlett
Reviews.Content: My husband I spent a few nights at the Hotel Londra Palace on a trip to Italy. I had told the hotel in advance that we were celebrating his birthday and when we arrived they said they had upgraded us to the Tchaikovsky Suite free of charge. Our room had a fabulous view. But this as nice as it was wasn't what made our stay so enjoyable. It was the excellent service that was so outstanding. From the very helpful concierge to the cheerful smiling waitress at breakfast (an excellent buffet) everyone made us feel special and welcome. We stayed at some very expensive hotels during our stay in France and Italy but none of them all be it a bit better appointed could match the Hotel Londra Palace for service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Teresa S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Londra Palace for 4 nights in April after reading all the positive reviews on Tripadvisor, and it did not disappoint. We booked a room with a view of the lagoon for ourselves, and a room with a view of rooftops for our sons. They didn't have much of a view but were more interested in the TV anyway. Both rooms and bathrooms were in tip-top condition, beautifully furnished, and the lady who cleaned them every day and prepared them for the night was brilliant. She really added to the pleasure of the stay. The hotel is in a fantastic location right on a wide promenade called the Riva degli Schiavoni and we delighted in the spectacle of Venice below our bedroom window on the second floor -- street artists, groups of students singing, stalls and gondolas, and the occasional huge cruise-ship gliding by. It is just a hop from San Marco piazza, really convenient. As everyone has said, it is also right near the vaporetto and water taxi stops. It was worthwhile for our family of four to take the water-taxi from the airport, a tremendous experience. The rest of the time we used vaporettos, which added to the special feeling of being in Venice. We booked the Tchaikovsky package which included a dinner in their restaurant, and the service was superb -- the maitre d' and his two waiters made us feel very well looked after and cosseted. We had cocktails in the bar before dinner, and I would highly recommend drinks at the bar as they are top-notch. They make their bellinis properly, from fresh ripe white peaches, so not available in the spring. I was recommended a rossini instead, made from fresh strawberry puree and topped with fizz, and it was utterly delicious. My husband's dry martini made him close his eyes with pleasure. All in all, a great stay in an extremely well-run hotel. You didn't notice the effort they were making, which is what a very good hotel is all about. The bald concierge with the funky glasses was particularly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel. Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: rezz_shaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. A charming hotel with charming history with friendly and professional staff to compliment it. Hotel faces St. Mark Basin with its front porch lined with water-bus station, water taxi station and a few steps away the gondola station. Less than 5 minutes walking to St Marks Square and Bridge of Sigh. From there u could leisurely stroll towards Rialto Brigde and take the water-bus down the Grand Canal back to the hotel. Could not ask for better location. We booked the junior suite with a balcony facing the basin, view is spectacular. Room is elegantly charming, but for a suite, I visualized bigger space. A perfect choice for couples looking for a romantic experience of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hide away from the crowded throng”
Reviews.Author: muaaussiemum
Reviews.Content: Our second stay in this lovely hotel, but would have to say was the worst buffet breakfast we've ever had at the five star level.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel W
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a beautiful location, helpful friendly staff... what more can I say!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful experience!”
Reviews.Author: sulu0_6
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable room, with quality linens and a beautiful bath! The room was dotted with quality antiques and the beds were extremely comfortable. We had a magnificient view of the Grande Canal and we were a 2 minute walk to St Mark's Square. What more could you ask for? Well we indeed had more! A really upscale breakfast offering a very good selection of foods. Also, we received extremely courteous, expert service from the employees of the hotel. Plus the bar is a gem, very upscale and sophisticated! The mojitos they made at the bar, by the way, were the best we have ever had. I would definitely recommend this property and on my return to Venice, I will definitely stay there again. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: marigo13
Reviews.Content: What other reviewers have written about this hotel is true and it is an excellent place to spend a few days while experiencing Venice. The concierge is very helpful, in particular, Alvice. He is above there with the best. His travel, transport and restaurant recommendations were on the dot and went the extra mile to secure reservations for our dinner and lunch requests. The rooms are larger than the standard European hotel rooms. Clean and relatively modern, probably a late 1990s or early 2000 era renovation. Airconditioning in the rooms which is important as not all European hotels provide air-conditions. Nice breakfast spread although eggs have to be ordered separately and not included in the breakfast package. Free internet, which is so rare in Europe. The location cannot be beat as mentioned by other reviewers. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: valuewise1
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the location . . . right in the heart of Venice, everything minutes away. The room and bathroom are sumptuous, with a heated towel rack in the bathroom, spacious, clean with fresh flowers! Our view was overlooking rooftops and church, no complaints! The staff was very helpful when our prearranged transportation did not show up, making a call for us on departure. The front desk also recommended a quiet little church for Sunday services as a new patriarch was coming to the San Marco Basilica that day. We splurged on this hotel and did not regret it for a moment. Beautiful lounge areas and wonderful breakfast. Afternoon coffee and cookies!

Reviews.Title: “a room with a view”
Reviews.Author: tripcat900
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 4-day trip to Venice. Location is second to none, only steps from San Marco and with open views to the Laguna. Very easily reached by boat, most Vaporetto's virtually stop at its doorstep. Our spacious room had marvelous views and a poststamp-sized balcony that overlooked the laguna. Hotel combines bygone charm with modern comfort, and is very well kept and classy. We would certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “picture perfect as the city itself”
Reviews.Author: mainevent
Reviews.Content: elegance, hospitality, delight. our four day stay in venice was just perfect. loved the afternoon coffee/tea service and the quiet elegance of the hotel. room was an absolute gem facing the lagoon, everything clean and of high quality. free wifi or computer to use at the sitting area. breakfast was good with fresh squeezed orange juice and the staff most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Here-there-everywher
Reviews.Content: If you booked a room with canal views, you will not be disappointed. Open your window to amazing views of grand canal and rest of Venice lagoon. Hotel's location is perfect. There is also a pier right outside where the taxi boat from the airport stops. The breakfast buffet is very nice with lots of different kinds of fruits and pastries. The area (restaurant) where breakfast is served is very beautifully decorated in mostly white. The rooms are decorated tastefully as well but the wear and tear of time is begining to show. Everything works but you may notice the scratches, chipped paint here and there. I particularly did not like the air condition unit which made too much noise for my liking. I'd return to this hotel if I want to spend this much money next time I'm in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing views, perfect location & beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: H0lidayers2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely fantastic! Location (basically at the San Marco vaperetto stop), junior suite was stunning with sea views & helpful staff. Great hotel bar too & not a bad buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: 829HelenQ
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderfully calm and relaxing atmosphere. The staff are friendly and helpful, the place is spotlessly clean, the food, both breakfast and in the restaurant, is excellent and the location couldn't be better for Venice's main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarieDarricau1
Reviews.Content: we spent a weekend in venice in this hotel, we've stayed in room #100, which was fine. The hotel has a great location, very easy to arrive by taxi boat from the airport. The staff was more than caring, they were always anxious to help and to give us good suggestions of where to eat, which places to see... We were very happy with the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and very caring staff”
Reviews.Author: cwpnewpaltz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Londra Palace three times, though not recently. It was lovely, a respite in a very touristy city, with large, gracious rooms. The roof deck was gorgeous. I am about to make another reservation, and I feel compelled to tell a story about a previous stay, after flying from New York specifically to get to Easter Mass at St. Mark's. For the first time in my life, I arrived in Venice by air and not by car, and we decided to splurge on a water taxi. The hotel is on the Grand Canal, and we expected an uneventful and straightforward arrival. After I paid and got out of the taxi, a very brusque, large German man pushed past my wife and shoved her into a brand new piling sticking up from the water at the dock. There was a 6 inch splinter on that piling that pierced my wife's Achilles tendon and effectively crucified her to the piling. She was in agony, screaming loudly. I ran into the Londra Palace, gave them my name, explained what happened and asked them to get an ambulance right away. I said that in light of this incident, we might not be able to stay. They were very solicitous and efficient, the ambulance (a water taxi with a litter and medical crew, naturally) came and took my wife, but not me, to the hospital. By the time I got there, she was already in the operating room and fifteen minutes later they wheeled her out. The hospital refused payment and gave us two prescription scrips, an antibiotic and a painkiller, which she had to fill elsewhere because they had no dispensary. It was the afternoon of Holy Saturday, and this would prove to be no small task. Their instructions to her were to take the medication, to never get into a boat for the rest of the time we were in Venice but instead to walk everywhere, and if the pain got too intense, to have a martini. We found a pharmacy near the Rialto Bridge just before it closed, and despite this trauma, we had a lovely time walking all over the city, eating in the fine restaurant at the hotel and elsewhere and being doted on by the staff. We never got to Easter Mass. When we got home, my wife went to the Hospital for Special Surgery in NYC to see if everything had been done properly, and her orthopedic surgeon was stunned. "If that had happened here, we would have had you on physical therapy for six months. It's perfect and you're walking just fine. Have a martini." So everything worked out thanks to the front desk of the Londra Palace. This is definitely a special place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatF83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April 2011 and the stay was brilliant. The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive. The room had a wonderful view over the lagoon and the hotel is located in a fabulous location within walking distance to all the main attractions. Ate in the restaurant one night and had a lovely meal. Afternoon tea with the amazing biscuits was very welcome. The concierge had some good suggestions of places to eat around the area

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: There's not much to be said that hasn't been written. It's a respite in a crazy, wonderful city. The people who work here are all, each and every one, lovely and helpful. It somehow manages to feel homey while not feeling bed and breakfast-y. The details from the front door down to the pillow on your bed are all thoughtful and beautiful. I would recommend anyone stay here

Reviews.Title: “I'll return!”
Reviews.Author: OscarWilde1
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about. Beautiful setting overlooking lagoon and 5 minute walk to piazza San Marco. Stayed in topmost central spacious room and was graced by the sound of gulls swirling over Serenissima every morning. Service was second to none and complimentary tea every afternoon was also welcome. Good breakfast. Restaurant looks lovely but never eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FLD81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located two bridges away from the Doge's Palace (about 5 minutes walk). From there you have access to St Marks, etc so it is a great starting point. The gondolas, water taxis and vaporetta's are all available outside the hotel door which again makes it a great location. The breakfast was a very standard continental one. We were most disappointed that the restaurant was not open. Although we had emailed the hotel a number of times prior to our arrival, in none of these was it mentioned that the restaurant was closed. It wasn't until we went down to eat the first night of our stay that we found out. In January a number of nearby restaurants were closed so it made it difficult. We found it easier to eat dinner on the way back to the hotel in the evenings rather than return to the hotel and then go out.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: seaajfc
Reviews.Content: Londra sits right on the Grand Canal, with majestic views of Venice. It is directly across from the Basillica San Giorgio Majore and steps from St Mark's Square and Palazzo Ducale. With convienient taxi and bus stops outside, you can move about Venice with ease. The rooms are large, well appointed and even have 110 Volt outlets in the room and bathrooms- VERY unusual for Europe! You also can join rooms to make a large suite if traveling as a family. It's worth the small extra $ to get a Canal view- you have a sweeping 180 degree view of both sunrise and sunset!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay! Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: dhiraj_traveller
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Londra Palace last year in February for my honeymoon. It was our first stop in Italy and Venice and Londra Palace set up an amazing experience. I must say the hotel is amazing and the best hotel that I have stayed at. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful. They even arranged a trip to Murano for us. The breakfast is amazing. The location of the hotel is very good. It is walking distance from St. Marks' square. I want to visit Venice again and will definitely stay at Londra Palace the next time also but I will book a room with water view. Everything about this hotel is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic ! We must return.”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of Venice carnival in February and from the moment we left the water taxi and walked into the lobby we knew it was going to be special. The concierge was very welcoming and escorted us to our room followed a few minutes later by the porter with our luggage. He showed us how to operate the climate control and get English channels on TV, small touches but welcome. Our room was a junior suite (312) and was very spacious with a huge bed, dining table and chairs, dressing table and sofa. There is also a mini bar and safe. The en suite was very luxurious with robes and slippers, quality towels (changed twice a day) and cosmetics. There was even an illuminated magnifying mirror (ideal for those who need help applying their make up) Our suite was on the third floor with a small balcony and fantastic views of the lagoon. The public rooms are spotlessly clean and very tastefully decorated. The hotel offers complimentary tea, coffee and cappuccino in the lounges every day between 4:00 and 5:30. Free wi fi is available and they run a free shuttle to Murano. The only obligation is that you watch a demonstration of glass making (amazing) and have a look round the store but there is no pressure to buy anything. You can then wander around Murano at your leisure and get the free boat back. We ate every evening in the hotel restaurant, Do Leoni, which is the subject of a separate review but I would highly reccomend it although expensive. The buffet breakfast included in the room rate is quite sufficient with cereals, breads, pastries, meats, cheeses, fruit, yogurt, cakes and juices but you can order cooked food at extra cost if you so wish. The location of the hotel is perfect being a 3 to 5 minute walk from piazza San Marco and with the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop out front getting around is easy. All in all a fantastic place to stay with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Londra palace hotel made our 4 day Venetian stay such a pleasant experience.”
Reviews.Author: Mawso
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great position, easily accessible from the airport by water taxi, fantastic views, junior suites have plenty of space and are beautifully furnished, very friendly and helpful staff, delicious breakfast, very enjoyable afternoon tea, especially after walking the maze of venetian streets all day, free WiFi for keeping up to date, marble bathroom with good sized bath, easily able to regulate our rooms temperature for comfort. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel which we selected due to trip advisor reviews. Especially, we found the staff more than friendly. They went out of their way to help us with timetables, restaurant suggestions, and sights we might appreciate, particularly the lovely Alvise. Thanks so much.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Peter B
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is definitely recommendable! Super service. The best - the barman was sensational, he does the Martini the old fashion way and knows his business at its best. Breakfast is rich. Rooms (we had Lagoon view) are perfect in an old fashion style. All staff was very friendly and helpful. Peter

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location and Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Muttly3699
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Hotel Londra Palace for four nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is located within a short walk to St Mark's square and, providing you have a front room, has beautiful views across the laguna and St George's island. We had a suite which is not much larger than a western motel room but quite spacious for two adults. The bed was very comfortable and there was a bath, both necessaties after foot slogging it around Venice. The concierge was extremely helpful in arranging transfers, giving directions and recommending places to eat. The complimentary breakfast was basic but adequate and the pastries were above par. The hotel has WiFi which is adequate for checking emails and general surfing where speed is not paramount. The one disappointment was that the kitchen was being refurbished while we were there so it wasn't possible to eat at the hotel restaurant. As this was off season it is understandable that it was being done at that time but no one had informed us that the restaurant wasn't open until we had gone to eat there. Other than this it was a most pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “60 in venice, italy”
Reviews.Author: david H
Reviews.Content: what a place to spend your 60th birthday, my room had fabulous views over the Laguna of Venice, the hotel staff were excellent and offered a high standard of service. I would recommend this hotel for its location, accommodation and service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice!”
Reviews.Author: sushikick
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for my honeymoon, and was pleasantly surprised by the hotel's flexibility in terms of service! I really appreciated how responsive they were, and would definitely stay again. Traveling in Italy can be exhausting at times, especially with the "I know best attitude" - this place definitely rose above that standard - hats off to the management. The location was also incredible, as was the view, the room, and amenities. We really enjoyed ourselves, and I'm happy to recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view!”
Reviews.Author: Holidaytaste
Reviews.Content: The view of the boats entering the grand canal is amazing. Our room is decorated very elegantly and has lovely furnishings. The staff have been helpful with organising day trips, restaraunts and travel. Speaking English and Italian fluenlty. Breakfast is nice too, not the most hot options (eggs only) but a variety of cheese, hams, fruit and yoghurt. We loved the say as we booked last minute, in winter, and paid approx 200 euro which seemed wonderful for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Roger W
Reviews.Content: I chose Londra Palace because of good tripadvisor reviews and I was not disappointed, the good experience started with an easy website on which to book, with all offers made clear, then a couple of days before arrival the hotel sent an email requesting details of any information or needs we may have wished(doesn't cost anything but a nice touch). On arrival the staff could not have been more welcoming and indeed all the way through our three day stay all staff(with such excellent English that we felt unworthy) were exactly as attentive as they should have been, i.e. there when you needed them. As the hotel restaurant was closed, the recommendations made for eating out were excellent and tailored to the price one wished to pay. Breakfast was excellent and available until 10.30, the housekeeping service, though never seen, was also excellent. Our room had arguably the best views in Venice and only a few hundred metres to San Marco, also the water taxi jetty is only a few yards away which is important on arrival, this hotel is unlikely to disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Venice”
Reviews.Author: FBendall
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Londra was a piece of luxury in a European tour. We found the hotel via the Tripadvisor community as we did with all the hotels we have booked for out European tour from Australia. It really is a superb location, wonderful rooms and a real delight. The staff were great - BUT negative side and warning, they will offer "free" boat rides to Murano island to the glass factory, we went on recommendation before looking around Venice and got completely ripped off. We later found than pieces we brought are chinese rip offs. It was a real downer and especially since the recommendation came from the hotel. Apparently this is a "typical tourist ploy" Other than that, while generally more expensive than Rome or Paris or London, Venice offers something very very special. It was romantic, even though we had our 7 year old in tow! It was full of surprises and I think the 2 nights and 1 full day, meant we left wanting more, but not too much more!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location, Service, Quality, and PRICE !”
Reviews.Author: D2Dogs
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent suggested the Londra Palace....great call. It's located right on the Canals just a minute or 2 walk to St. Mark's, Doge's Palace, and Bridge of Sighs. It's a very clean hotel. Staff was really nice. The restaurant was really good (try the mint chocolate chip gelato). Our room was 3rd floor looking out towards the statue and canal. Finally, the price was very reasonable for the quality and location. The only draw back is it seems to be located on the part of th canal where the cruise ships let off, so it got a little congested. That being said, We were extremely pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: Salsaa
Reviews.Content: A stay at this hotel was a beautiful gift, and an unfrgettable experience. Exceptional service, beautiful rooms and views of Venice, absolutely stunning!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: su2320
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a few days to unwind right after Christmas. The hotel is located right behind Piazza San Marco in an excellent location with stunning views of the Grand Canal. Our room was lovely with a small balcony where we enjoyed watching the magnificent sunsets in the evening. The hotel staff were all extremely helpful and pleasant whenever we needed something. We didn't get up in time to enjoy the breakfast, but did order a tray up to our room and it arrived quickly with a nice assortment of bread, sweets, yogurt and coffee. The hotel's location is steps away from the Vaporetto stop for Piazza San Marco/Zaccaria, so if you choose to arrive via Vaporetto vs water taxi it is easy and convenient. I would definitely stay at this hotel again when we return to Venice,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Polly255060
Reviews.Content: Most enjoyable couple of days at this hotel just prior to Christmas. Location excellent. Breakfast is served in a very elegant setting. Afternoon tea each afternoon at 4PM in lounge very appreciated. Watching the sunset from the roof of the hotel was magical.

Reviews.Title: “Londra Palace: Gracious. Clean, refined, Italian elegance”
Reviews.Author: KateLaurent
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor reviews steered us toward Hotel Londra Palace, and for that we are grateful; our stay in Venice could not have been better!! We entered Venice by water taxi and were dropped off directly in front of the hotel on the busy waterfront promenade. As we walked into the lobby, the contrast between the touristy din outside and the peaceful atmosphere inside was striking. The atmosphere within the Londra Palace was completely peaceful, well-organized and accommodating...not to mention STUNNING!! The first impression is one of pure comfort and refinement. Warm, Venetian plaster walls, subtle mosaic floors, and exquisitely crafted Murano glass chandeliers greet your eyes as you enter the pale hotel lobby. The surrounding furniture is mid-century modern, upholstered in cream leather and accompanied by mid-tone wood tables, each table accented by a single clipped orchid. We were immediately greeted by a gracious, well-trained concierge who then personally escorted us to our room on the 4th floor. The room was of Neo-classical styling, spacious and offered an amazing view of the Grand Canal and the Church of San Giorgio Maggiore. However, perhaps one of the best parts of the hotel is their amazing Breakfast Buffet (included in the price of your room). Every morning you start with breakfast on the first floor patio. The staff sets up a spread consisting of every delicious option you can dream of and they serve you coffee as you watch the street vendors set up their daily wares. ~Itâ€™s so relaxing, you feel pampered in this hotel oasis, yet free to come and go as you please. (Note: The hotelâ€™s classic Venetian Bellinis are amazing, fresh peach and not to be missed!) The Hotel Londra Palace provides glorious respite from the crowds of Venice, and their unparalleled service makes you feel appreciated and welcomed each time you return.

Reviews.Title: “Second Christmas Break”
Reviews.Author: michaelcollier
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Christmas in 2010. We enjoyed it so much that we returned at Christmas 2011! The hotel is fantastic. The view from our private terrace was amazing. The grand canal on one side and the distant Alps from the other. The room itself (a mini-suite) was lovely. The food in the restaurant was superb and good value. I have nothing but praise for all the staff who were so friendly and helpful and made our stay (again) so special. Christmas at this Venice hotel is so romantic. We would not want to stay anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sman_01
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was excellent. Breakfast was superb. Location right next to S. Mark's Square. Hotel staff very very friendly. 'nough said.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pete N
Reviews.Content: I only gave it a rating of 5 out of 5 but it deserves so much more. An outstanding hotel experience. I booked this as a treat for my partners birthday and arrived stressed from work and my journey. As we are not used to "luxury" hotels I did not really have an expectation apart from perhaps being a little out of my depth. Upon arrival the staff took control of me and assisted with our luggage which immediatly made us feel special and much needed as I was stressed from the jouney and almost 6 months of over work. Throughout our stay everything was perfect in every way. The rooms are trully beautiful, clean, light and airy. We had a logoon view with a balcony which was so worth the extra. The bed and the linen gave me probably the best nights sleep in 6 months. In fact I want one of those beds. The bathroom was beautiful and the shower amazing. The staff were unbelievable. Knowledgable, couteous and polite and certainly not what I expected at this end of the luxury spectrum, to be honest I did not know what to expect. Nothing was too much trouble for them with me or any of the other guests. They were simply there when you needed them and seemed to almost anticipate when you needed them and then melted back into the background which is probably the most difficult thing to get a good balance of. This includes the staff looking after our room. The bar area, breakfast/restaurant and lobby were bright, clean and very relaxing. Really felt relaxed straight away and enjoyed our stay at this hotel enormously. I have personally stayed in many many hotels in the UK and across Europe, admittedly not 4 star but service should be good no matter where you are. Here it was outstanding. As a base to see the most beautiful city in the world I simply cannot praise this hotel highly enough. They made us feel special and that is priceless. A personal message to Alain Bullo, I really do not understand some of the more negative reports. Everything was perfect in every way. Thank your staff for me and keep up the excellent work, your hotel certainly deserves the accollades it has. I will return but next time I think I will take a suite and relly live the high life. Thankyou for helping make our break extra special we trully did find probably one of the best hotels on the planet in probably one of the most beautiful cities on the planet a trully fantastic break. You put a smile on our faces and helped create memories that will remain with us forever Pete and Jan

Reviews.Title: “The magic of Venice...”
Reviews.Author: Mysteriouskat
Reviews.Content: Arguably, much of the hotelâ€™s charm is owed to its location, a few steps off Saint Markâ€™s Square, right next to the lagoon. If youâ€™re lucky enough to be in one of the suites with terraces that overlook it, youâ€™re in for pure magic. Thereâ€™s no feeling guilty about staying in and missing Veniceâ€™s finest offerings here. You can enjoy a leisurely (and perhaps, romantic) breakfast on the terrace taking in the stunning views and following the hustle & bustle of the city as it unfolds beneath you. With such inspiring surroundings, itâ€™s no wonder that Tchaikovsky composed much of his Fourth Symphony here (in room #108, if you want to be specific). The rooms themselves are luxurious and elegant, decorated in the gorgeous Neo-lombary/Biedermeier style, filled with 19th century antiques, original paintings and cushy furnishings that feel particularly Venetian. They are immaculately clean and exceptionally comfortable. The size is modest, but comfortable. A definite highlight, the pink marble bathroom, is a place to be pampered. True to form, there are generous bottles of a rather foamy bubble bath gel stocked, along with the usual amenities. Youâ€™re bound to feel like Venetian royalty here! The reception staff are a bit reserved, but very helpful. For a great dinner or lunch experience, try the hotelâ€™s â€œDo Leoniâ€� restaurant. With its outdoor terrace it is a great place to enjoy a meal â€“ and soak in the jaw-dropping views, of course. The water vaporetto from the airport stops right next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fall visit to Venezia”
Reviews.Author: Tony V
Reviews.Content: Though it was my first time, my family has stayed at Hotel Londra Palace previously and it was a truly excellent experience. The staff was friendly, the accommodations comfortable and the location without compare. While we stayed as a couple, there were plenty of families staying too and Fall was a great time to be in Venezia. Given the hotel's central location, the entire island was an easy walk and you could get around faster via vaporetto right out the front door.

Reviews.Title: “On the canal, great rooftop view, nice suite”
Reviews.Author: ViaggiatoreSF
Reviews.Content: Hotel Londra Palace was one of the most expensive places we have stayed because it's Venice and because I wanted a view, so we booked a suite. Of the four Jr Suites, we got the one that per the website would have been my last choice...however, I was wrong. On the website it looks dark, and maybe it is, but what I liked was that we had a front view of the canal, a side view of the canal and a back view of the old town. Also, at first we thought the hot tub in the middle of the room was odd, but after long days of walking...and getting lost everyday, I can't tell you how much we needed to unwind in that tub. We used it all four nights we were there. Not sure if this matters, but it is definitely an older clientelle, and we are not that young, but we felt we were one of the youngest couples there. Also, I had this romantic vision of sitting outside having breakfast and watching the canal, but in actuality, you are watching hoards and hoards of tour groups coming from the ships and buses. Every one of them walks by the hotel while you are having breakfast. You just can't imagine how many people are entering this small space. What was amazing was their small, roof top deck. No one was up there, a hidden gem. The pictures we took from up there were some of our best in Venice. We went two nights in a row for sunset. We also enjoyed coming back for afternoon tea. We missed tea our first day by 10 mins...and they absolutely were strict about the time, no tea for us. We had a variety of service experience, and at a place like this, it should be consistently good, but our good experience was really great. He did a big favor for us one day, and recommended such an amazing restaurant off the beaten path, along a very private canal (can't remember the name). The location is perfect for getting to all the key places or for catching a water boat. Splurge and take a water taxi from the train station. We took a water bus, and it must have taken an hour, we took the water taxi back...worth saving on time and it was such a fun experience. After reading TripAdvisor reviews, I absolutely did not want to stay anywhere else. I don't regret it for that reason, but next time, might pick a more intimate, boutique hotel place along a small canal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location & Views”
Reviews.Author: spangle1
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 2 nights stay at this hotel in October 2011 whilst travelling on route on the Orient Express train. Our lovely room at the front of the hotel had wnderful views & looked out onto the Lagoon. The staff were very pleasant, bed comfortable, bathroom very nice, lobby very pretty and the evening meal we had in the restaurant, sitting outside was excellent. The hotel is situated in an excellent location if you want to be close to the main square, lagoon, shops etc. Only upset we had was a mosquito in the room and found it very difficult to locate this annoying bug as it was well hidden against the dark brocade wallpaper and drapes in the room. We could only see it when it landed on the white ceiling. There was only one, so I guess we were unlucky and we hadn't packed any repellant this trip.

Reviews.Title: “No internet and felt unwelcomed....”
Reviews.Author: Mrandmrsvandao
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell: Good things about hotel: location, gorgeous first floor (lobby and restaurant) and decent sized room Poor things about hotel: Poor customer service, no internet connection, hard/stiff mattress sheets My husband and I just came back from our honeymoon and stayed at the Londra Palace for 4 nights. Generally, I do not like sharing bad reviews but since we based our hotel strictly on reviews from tripadvisor.com, I wanted to share our experience and thoughts so others could know what to expect. We would not consider this hotel a 5 star hotel (don't let the 1st floor mislead you)! The internet connection was down throughout our stay. When I walked downstairs each evening to inform the front desk, I was told that the server would be looked at in the morning and each day when we got back to our room in the evening, the internet never worked. Night after night, for 4 nights, I would be told that the internet is fine in the lobby, and for each night of my stay, I spent hours in the lobby versus the room that I paid for. Also, the hotel staff made us feel like we were bothering them when we asked them questions about anything (such as restaurant recommendations, activities or the internet connection) so that made each night returning to the hotel miserable because we never felt welcomed and very uncomfortable. The ONLY thing that we were "graciously" offered every morning was the trip to visit Murano. I felt very uncomfortable with that because it was the only thing we would be asked when we stopped by to the front desk (we only stopped by the front desk because we had to to drop off our room key). My husband and I felt like they were being too agressive about offering the trip to Murano daily because they did not care about how we were feeling about our stay or cared to address the issues about the internet connection that we expressed to them that we were very unhappy about. Finally, the sheets on the mattress were stiff and very uncomfortable! We still managed to enjoy our trip to Venice because of the great walks from the hotel and the awesome food (not because of the hotel stay)!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: TaksaTeckel
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 5 nights at Londra Palace. We originally booked a top floor room with lagoon views, but I messed up the dates of our reservation. I called panicking, 2 days before we were hoping to arrive, but the very gracious Fabiana quickly found us another room. (This was in November, so not during the most popular time of year.) I was a little disappointed, when we were checking in, that the new room is on the 1st floor and right above the restaurant; but that concern quickly went a away when we saw the room. Our Junior Suite was lavishly decorated, spacious and had two huge windows facing the statue in front of the hotel, the boats and gondolas, the lagoon, and the islands across it. We even had a little balcony to take it all in. The masses of tourists marching to and from the nearby San Marco were also right there, along with the many trinket sellers, but to me they were part of the entertainment; and they quickly disappeared, if you just looked up a little bit. At night the embankment was fairly empty and quiet, so noise during sleeping hours was never an issue. The beds were very comfortable, with linen sheets, light comforters and abundant pillows. The love seat converted into a single bed, but we did not need it. There was plenty of room to stow away your things and the dining table could easily accommodate 4 people. The bathroom was also large and well stocked with thick towels, lovely products and robes. I loved the powerful rain shower (although the drainage was very slow, we had to remove the stopper in order to prevent the bath from filling up, while taking a shower.) The TV did not work very well, we had to have someone come up and fix the Sky connections and the remotes only worked directly in front of the TV, not from the bed or the sofa; but who comes to Venice to watch tv anyway?!? We just used to it to catch the news for a half hour before retiring every night. We absolutely loved the abundant breakfasts every morning and the very well prepared room service dinner we had the first night. I also enjoyed an early evening drink at the bar every day, by the third day the bartender asked "The usual?", which made me feel special and at home. The drinks were served with biscuits, canapÃ©s and really nice dark chocolate. All the staff we met was incredibly polite, helpful and friendly; from management to front desk, the servers, porters and maids. Everyone spoke lovely English. The vaporetto stop is directly across from the hotel, which made it easy to explore the city and to get back to the train station at the end of our stay. (We splurged for a â‚¬60 taxi from the train station to the hotel, but it's really not necessary, the vaporetto is a lot cheaper and only takes about 10 minutes longer.) This was my fourth visit to Venice and I really can't decide if I liked staying in the middle of it all or, as in previous visits, further away, in a locanda in a dark and romantic alley. Both options have their pluses and minuses, but if you want to be centrally located and within easy reach to all the major destinations I think you'd truly enjoy a stay at The Londra Palace. A+

Reviews.Title: “Really good and then the meal at the end made it excellent”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller43
Reviews.Content: Really good quality hotel. Room was a very decent size. Service at the front desk was very good and good recommendations for food and what to do if the weather isn't great. We had the Tchaikovsky package - really worthwhile for the meal. We weren't even sure we would use the meal but it was pouring with rain so we decided to take up the option and were really, really happy with it - the food, which was excellent just didn't stop coming. Overall would happily stay there again when I go back to Venice which I'm sure I will because it is a great city to visit. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Holiday of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra S
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful short stay at Hotel Londra Palace - many excellent places to travel to via the Grand Canal. Magical city - plan to return one day. We had travelled on the Orient Express to Santa Lucia from London and had a wonderful welcome at the luxury hotel. The food catered for all tastes and the room had a great view of the Grand Canel with gondolas and many interesting sights to see day to day living of the Venetians.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Perfect Position”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker2020
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Londra Palace at the end of September on a short four night break. Booked the hotel as a result of the excellent Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. The position of the hotel could not be beaten. As many have said it is right next to where the waterbus arrives from the airport and couild not be more convenient. It is a stones throw from St Mark's Square and other major sights which allows you to be there early/late to beat the hordes of other tourists. The hotel itself was very comfortable and the breakfast excellent. Our room was at the rear overlooking rooftops but that was no bad thing...very peaceful. There was free Wi-Fi after getting the password from reception.We particularly enjoyed sitting on the terrace at the front of the hotel mid afternoon enjoying our complimentary tea. We did not eat in the restaurant so cannot comment on quality. Staff we generally friendly and efficient although I sensed the house "style" was to remain a little reserved in the way you might expect in an up-market hotel. I can see how some people might read this as being unfriendly. Just a comment not a criticism!

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Herb2Aud
Reviews.Content: This is a very lovely small boutique hotel that is a five minute walk from St. Marks Square. We were able to walk all over Venice from this location. The rooms are done in the old Venetian style with very large bathrooms. We had a lovely view of the Grand Canal. The staff was most helpful in helping us get from place to place because the water taxis are very expensive and it is easy to walk all over the city. We had a nice continental buffet breakfast with excellent coffee.

Reviews.Title: “a truly elegant hotel”
Reviews.Content: The Londra Palace is a lovely hotel with caring and efficient personnel . The location is perfect right near San Marco Square and looking out at the Grand Canal. The rooms are elegant and the beds are comfortable. The hl.eating racks for the towels were appreciated after a shower. Breakfast was in a lovely room looking onto the promenade along the Grand Canal

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, impeccable and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: cosmopolitalian
Reviews.Content: Booked a Superior room, with a view over the Canal Grande. From the moment we walked through reception, everything has been simply perfect. The staff is very polite and friendly, the room is large and with great views. Even a last minute wish to have breakfast in the room was delivered quickly and smoothly. Very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Londra Palace”
Reviews.Author: Anselm24
Reviews.Content: I have been to Venice a number of times - as has my mother. This trip was special - she is in her mid 80s and as her sight deteriorates I doubt she will be able to come again. We had a fabulous room at the Londra Palace - spacious, airy, bright, with a delightul balcony and a fabulous view across the lagoon. Perfect. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom quite luxy with a good shower. The staff were charming and attentive without being in any way patronising. We had a couple of lovely lunches sitting on the terrace in the late October sunshine watching the world go by. We were helped enormously by the wonderful concierges Aldo and Alvise who booked restaurants for us, advised on complicated vaporetto journeys and were generally a fantastic source of information about a city which they know and clearly love. Next time I am in Venice I will definitely come back to this hotel - I don't think you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location & hotel”
Reviews.Author: havebagwilltravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Londra Palace and loved it. The room was charming, large by European standards, and overlooked a courtyard. The hotel itself in on the Grand Canal with a perfect spot at their outdoor restaurant to have breakfast and watch the world go by. And trust me, the world does go by this location. The staff was incredibly helpful and attentive. We will stay there again on our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Merchanda
Reviews.Content: Arriving to Venice in the vaporetto at sunset is an experience very tough to beat, let alone to forget. The hotel was magnificent, not cheap though, but well worth it. The room was spacious (as per European standards) but the view was out of this world. Waking up every morning to see the Santa Maria della Salute is indeed priceless. The breakfast at the hotel was the best meal we had during our stay in Venice and all the staff was extremely polite and very accommodating. All in all, the perfect set up for a proposal!

Reviews.Title: “londra palace”
Reviews.Author: zarknyc
Reviews.Content: we just stayed 3 nights in the londra palace. positives: great location, instant room upgrade, terrific breakfast, the employees knew us by name immediately. negatives: the hotel was a bit shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: Since this was my second trip to Venice, I understood that you have to pay more than you would expect because of the location. The hotel far surpassed my expectations. The location was amazing, just steps from San Marco. The room was large, well appointed and well air-conditioned without being overbearing. The bed was comfortable and soft. The bathroom large with a great strong shower. The staff was very helpful and attentive. The free wifi was an unexpected bonus as was the free latte in the afternoon. All in all, I had a wonderful experience and would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: TOURtheWORLDMexPal
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights in September (high season). Most of the front desk people(concierge) were very helpful, in particular one guy name Alvise he was extremely knowledgeable and directed us very well, from best restaurants, gondola tour, attraction visits... He made our three days stay very productive and enjoyable. The room was decent size, nothing extra. The balcony what made itâ€™s price tolerable. Very comfortable bed and a very nice powerful shower. Breakfast was good (although the same exact selection every single day). My impression, well worth the money and I highly recommend it to everyone within the price range ($800 per night).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Macstar11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite and found it spacious with a large bathroom and sitting area and Lounge. The hotel was close to St Marks Square and all the water transport and has a great view of the hustle and bustle of the grand canal. The breakfast was more than ample and the restaurant food was superb. We found the staff more than helpful with all of our tourist inquires and the hotel will organize a boat to Murano if required. Couldn't fault Londra Palace,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Ken B
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights in a fifth floor junior suite with a patio/balcony (room 510). The room was very spacious and very well appointed. The bathroom was likewise excellent (two sinks and shower choices with bath). The patio/balcony was good sized and looked out in three directions at the lagoon and up the Grand Canal as well as to the San Zacarello church and beyond. The room was very quiet. Occasional noise distraction as guests use the stairs to get to the rooftop balcony (which is only open part of the day), but this was minor at most. Service was quite good. The restaurant had very good food. Breakfast is cold buffet and quality and variety is excellent (fresh juice, fresh fruits, many pastry options, cereals, hams and cheeses, etc). Dining service is spotty. Sometimes good, sometimes not.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with waterviews of lagoon”
Reviews.Author: Moveround
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Londra Palace Venice for 2 nights in June 2011. We had a beautiful room on the front of the building with a terrific view of the lagoon. We were only steps away from St Marks Square & Bascilicia. Transport was right outside our front door either by vaporette or water taxi. The hotel was luxurious with murano glass fittings. Our rate included breakfast which could be taken either inside or on the restaurant on the waterfront. While this area is extrememly busy with tourists it is very central to all tourists locations and terrific for transport. The hotel staff were excellent and food great. We did however have difficulty getting toast for breakfast. It seems like warmed up pale bread was the best the hotel could do. We took a vaporette from the train station to the hotel and this was very difficult to negoiate with our rather heavy luggage. I would advise taking a water taxi although that is expensive. We took a water taxi to our cruise ship and this was great. The cost was approx 90 euros and they took our luggage from the hotel to the taxi We would recommend this hotel.especially for location.

Reviews.Title: “We love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: R0bGill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Londra Palace hotel when celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary in 2006 before going on the Orient-Express to Paris. At the time we had noted a comment about room 416 and the large balcony and requested and were given this room. The room is stunning and It was fantastic to sit on the balcony and to see all the boats coming ang going. This time, to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary, we again requested this Junior Suite room and the hotel met our request and also left us a nice bottle of chilled sparkling wine and glasses for our arrival. This hotel is special and you are looked after very well. The complimentary teas, coffees etc between 4:00 and 5:30 was very nice and a good way to relax after being out for the day and before going up to our room for that stunning 4th floor room and long balcony. We couldn't wait to sit out there with a drink or two and watch all the activity on the water and quayside front. For a room with a view room 416 cannot be beat. We visited Murano and Barano (beautiful) as well as losing ourselves in the passageways and canals of Venice. We also visited the little island opposite the Londra Palace for great views of all of Venice. We hopped on and off the Vaporetto's during the day and evenings using our 72 hour passes and found some lovely places to eat and drink. Venice is much more expensive than when we were here 5 years ago but we still think this is the most romantic of cities and Hotel Londra Palace ticks all the boxes. Thank you to everyone at the Londra Palace for making our stay so special and perfect once again. We hope to be back, maybe for our 35th! Rob & Sally Gill

Reviews.Title: “beautiful lagoon views”
Reviews.Author: MFHLouisville_KY
Reviews.Content: wonderful location for st. mark's square and a quick trip to venice! taxi ride to train station is expensive but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we'll be back soon”
Reviews.Author: beverleysblue
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel. The location was ideal for seeing all the sights. The hotel was spotless and the staff were very friendly and could'nt do enough to help. Would recommend it . Cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault - location, room, view. Well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Leebod
Reviews.Content: I've been to Venice once before and stayed in the Danieli almost next door. The Londra Palace does not have the ostentatious interior of that Hotel but then doesn't cost anywhere near as much for a room thats just as lovely with that view to boot. We had room 108 that had a great view overlooking the lagoon (slightly higher up maybe better as the statue in front of the hotel is rather large!) - the wall coverings appeared new and were beautiful. The marble bathroom was fine though the rain shower over the bath is not as nice as a proper one though pressure was adequate. The bed was great and very comfortable - we both slept well. English speaking TV is limited (who cares - better things to do in venice in a hotel room) though there is free wifi for which bizarrely when I asked for access was sent someone up to the room with a piece of paper with the codes printed on them. I'd already alerted the hotel to our tenth anniversary and they supplied a complimentary bottle of prosecco on ice which was a welcome sight after returning from a day in baking heat. We only ate in the hotel for the buffet breakfast which was included in our rate and was perfectly acceptable if not outstanding. All the staff were excellent and efficient with the only minor gripe being at checkout when after paying 800 euro's plus for two nights we didnt even get a thank you / goodbye or a 'did you enjoy your stay?'! perhaps our earlyish checkout caught the night staff at the end of his shift. On the whole I would highly recommend this hotel and think that it offers comparitive 'value' for such a central location - stay here and have a couple of drinks at the danieli in the evening and save a fortune!! With the money you save you can arrive in style on the 110 euro taxi rides each way from/to Marco Polo airport instead of the truly horrible Alilaguna line at 25 euro return where you feel like a trapped slave - believe me it seems expensive but it is soooo worth it. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect celebration ! A perfect Stay @ the Londra Palace in Venezzia”
Reviews.Author: Vahineinbora
Reviews.Content: When traveling , especially to Venice, Italy , once should always think of 1 word: LOCATION! In any other city in the world, even though location is always a plus, one can always get by with the metro, bus, etc.. but the best location becomes heaven in Venice, Italy.. where busses and metro is non existent .. for one good reason: water is all over.. so you will be walking and using the fantastic mode of transportation along the wonderful canals. The Londra Place, located on the Grand Canal will not only be your home while visiting Venice, but will make your life so much easier - We LOVED our stay! I planned a surprise stay in Venice for my husband Birthday, and the team @ the Londra Palace delivered the BEST service and helped me planned this very special stay- We loved everything: the spacious rooms, the location ( once a gain), the service, the restaurant, the concierge knowledge.. we hope to be back for another wonderful visit ! Grazie Mille !!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Mizistanbul
Reviews.Content: After renting apartments year after year in Venice, we chose to stay in a hotel for a short visit this summer. I cannot say enough about the Hotel Londra Palace. From the first moments at the reception until our departure the Hotel and its gracious staff exceeded all of our expectations with their superior service and grace. We were upgraded to a gorgeous suite with a huge terrace overlooking the lagoon. The concierge recommended a wonderful restaurant and made sure our transfers to and from the airport were seamless. Breakfast was also full of lovely choices and well presented. While the hotel is quite old and some may consider it dated, we considered the decor part of its charm. We would definitely stay at the Londra Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to love about the Hotel Londra Palace?”
Reviews.Author: Marianna2
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Londra Palace is elegant, lovely and in a great location close to the water taxi (convenient for arrivals and departures), gondolas, vaporetto stop, and Piazza San Marco. The staff was pleasant and welcoming and always helpful, polite and professional. Upon checking in, our luggage was immediately taken up to our rooms from the lobby. We were invited to visit the roof top terrace. We ordered drinks at the bar and the bartender carried the drinks and nibblies up for us. We took the elevator to the 5th floor and then walked up the spiral staircase to the terrace seating area on the roof. Amazing views! We were the only ones up there. The bartender said to stay as long as we wished and leave things there and she would come back to take it all away. We watched all the activity on the lagoon until sunset. It was a fabulous way to begin our visit to Venice! We had a beautiful 4th floor lagoon view Junior Suite with a balcony which could accommodate 4 chairs and a small table. The views were amazing! The four of us sat out there sipping wine every evening before going out to dinner. Our son and DIL had a lovely Classic room with roof top views on the same floor with a huge bathroom with two sinks. Rooms were immaculate with pleasant dÃ©cor and top quality bed linens, towels and also robes and slippers â€“ a nice touch. Breakfast was perfect for us â€“ a good selection of a variety of breakfast items, pasteries, croissants, meats, cheeses, cereals, fruit, juices and great coffee â€“ always fresh and delicious. Breakfast staff greeted us each morning and was attentive to whatever we needed to start our day. The front desk staff was always available to help with restaurant suggestions, advice on getting from one place to another, where to buy a bottle of wine, etc. We had the pleasure of meeting Stefania, a manager, who was immensely patient and helpful when we made our reservations. On our first visit to Venice several years ago, my husband and I stayed in a highly rated small hotel (more of a B&B) in an off the beaten path location. We were on a small side canal. It was okay but, after having a wonderful experience staying at the Hotel Londra Palace, we would definitely return to the Londra Palace when we visit Venice in the future. We loved everything about the Hotel Londra Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: krysg
Reviews.Content: I've been travelling to Venice for 6 years now, and have had the pleasure of staying in many wonderful hotels (Ca Maria Adele, Centurion Palace, Monaco and Grand). I have to say, though, that the Londra Palace takes the prize. Understated, elegant, fantastic location, great food and service. Plus the best breakfast in Venice. Thank you very much. Krys Grudniewicz

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad after all.”
Reviews.Author: jeedeecee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have avoided going to Venice as we don't like overcrowded places, especially in the summer months. Due to a cancelled business trip we ended up with a few days off in Venice. We had booked a junior suite at the Londra Palace as it was directly accessible by boat and close to the main sightseeing places. After booking the room we read a few horror stories on this site which made us doubt our decision, especially the remarks about this rude lady manager. We went along regardless and we have to admit that we had a good time at the hotel. Everybody was quite welcoming and helpful. The room was as expected and we enjoyed watching the huge cruise boats sailing into Venice from our little but cute balcony. The biggest disappointment was the breakfast buffet that is quite poor in quality and choice. There is quite a lot of room for improvement in this area. Other than that, we mostly spent our time walking around Venice and discovering its many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous, exceeded my expectations...”
Reviews.Author: The_Dewey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely lovely. The lobby is spacious and elegant and our room absolutely amazed us. The front desk staff were friendly, welcoming, and helpful. Our baggage was brought up promptly as well as coffee that we ordered later on. There were a lot of little things that only added to the hotels charm, such as turn down service, fresh flowers in the bathroom, bathrobes, slippers, a little tray of cookies that comes with every coffee. Attention to detail is definitely a forte for this hotel. The breakfast in the morning is superb and the restaurant in the hotel, although quite pricey, is very delicious with five star service. The hotel is PERFECTLY situated on the Grand Canal, Piazza San Marco is a mere two minute walk and the Ponte dei Sospiri is quite literally, around the corner. Also, two Vaporetto stops are right in front of the hotel, so no need to haul luggage through cobblestone alleys and also makes sightseeing easier. I am usually VERY critical of hotels, even the finest, but I really can't say anything bad about the Londra Palace. I would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we stayed in for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: sarah_u_k87
Reviews.Content: We booked through Citalia and even though we had done our research it still was above our expectations! We stayed in 3 different hotels in Italy (Venice, Rome and Sorrento) and this was definitely our favourite. It certainly made our visit to Venice something that we will remember forever and makes us want to return. We were spoilt because it was our honeymoon and we therefore had a deluxe room overlooking the lagoon. I particularly enjoyed watching the hustle and bustle from our room and it certainly wasn't noisey on an evening. On our arrival we enjoyed a complimentary free lunch inlcuded wiht our booking and it was absolutely delightful. The breakfast was simple but delicious with plenty of choice. We tried out local restaurants each evening and we weren't disappointed. The room had an amazing view and luxurious decor. The bathroom had marble throughout and it was great to have a choice of shower or bath. Overall, I really would recommend this hotel to anyone. It may be expensive, but the benefits outweigh this and made the start of our honeymoon perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel, great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Steve9328
Reviews.Content: This was to be the top of the line hotel stay of our 4-city Europe trip. I knew Venice was going to be expensive all around and I decided to splurge on a water view room at this hotel. The hotel is very nice. Just down from Plazza San Marcos on the Riva degli Schiavoni it is close to the main sites of Venice. Be aware that the foot traffic is very high aloing the Riva degli Schiavoni with the cruise ships dropping their passengers off and walking aloing the Riva. The breakfast is wonderful, on the patio on the Riva degli Schiavoni. Overall I recommend this hotel. A bit on expensive side, but service is top notch and the hotel very nice. As you are probably aware the only way around Venice is by water taxi (or water bus) which stops near the hotel, but if you are going to stay at this hotel, you will likely take a private taxi which costs between 60-70 Euro to the train station and 100 Euro to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: plantsman_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb position overlooiking the lagoon with all the traffic that uses it, even the large cruise ships which perhaps should not be allowed so far into Venice. We had a suite overlooking the lagoon with good facilities and a lovely bathroom. It was lovely in the late evening opening the windows and watching all the boats pass by, with a chilled glass of prosecco in our hands. Breakfasts were excellent. We did not eat in the hotel, preferring to use the smaller restaurants in the streets behind. Wonderful fish suppers were on offer everywhere at reasonable prices. The hotel is right by the Vaporetto stop and with a weekend ticket it is so easy to travel up the Grand Canal to wherever you want. It is a short walk to St Mark's Square and if you wander up the side streets you will find many lovely bars and cafes. The complimentary afternoon tea and cakes in the hotel was a lovely surprise. We found the staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Definately "A Small Luxury Hotel of the World"”
Reviews.Author: foxy04
Reviews.Content: La Serenissima "the Most Serene Republic of Venice" is my wife's & my favourite vacation location. We have stayed in Hotel Londra Palace for the last 5 consecutive years and hope to continue staying there for many more years. It's easy for a hotel & it's staff to shine once but Londra Palace has excelled in all respects for all of our 5 visits. The hotel team, especially the front desk staff are "as good as they come" always willing and able to attend to guests every need / request. Service in all departments of the hotel is professional and cannot be criticised. The rooms are well appointed, spotlessly clean and are varied to suit a range of budgets. There is no doubt that this year the essential restoration works being carried out on the statue of Emanuel II outside the hotel will have clouded some peoples opinions of their stay but it has to be expected that Venice requires ongoing restoration works if it is to survive into the future. The hotel location no more than 500 meters from the San Zaccaria Danieli landing stage makes the transit from airport to hotel front door painless (use a private taxi to put the icing on the cake.) From the hotel all of Venice pans out in easily reachable segments. What we love best about Londra Palace is it's consistent high performance and there is nothing about the hotel we dislike. Dining in the hotel offers excellent food at reasonable prices - yes, you can eat cheaper elsewhere but quality & service will suffer. Roll on our next visit which we've booked already.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: joboy9
Reviews.Content: The title probably covers most of what I have to say about this hotel. The hotel itself is smart and comfortable. However it is in a bad position, just by the ferry landing for eveyone off the cruise ships. This took people watching, by the thousands, at breakfast, to a new level. Also shame about the scaffold on the statue in front of the hotel, blocking views from first floor junior suites. However that is not the hotels fault and will be down soon. Had a junior suite, comfortable but not large, I am comparing with other countries, so this may be standard for Venice. The room was clean but oh so drab, beige, brown and more beige. Cleaning staff appeared very good, which I cannot say for the general reception desk staff. Not rude or surly, but you did not feel a welcome guest, as in many other hotels, especially when you look at the cost, an arm and a leg plus other body parts. Generally overpriced for what they are offering, even by Venice standards and cost. However do not miss Venice, and find a different hotel, one in a quieter position away from the ferry landing point, even 100 yards further away from St Marks. The restaurant is a different kettle of fish and I am posting seperately on that.

Reviews.Title: “The best location, view and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nduk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here in July in a room facing the lagoon - the view was absolutely amazing! It really is at the centre of everything, we took the Alilaguna waterbus from the airport and got off & San Zaccaria pretty much in front of the hotel. It's very easy to find your way back to, just follow the signs 'Per San Marco' & spot the hotel from there. The room itself was large, well stocked and very comfortable - the bathroom was all marble and had a wonderfully powerful shower, air con was excellent. Breakfast was buffet style, and offered a huge selection of cold cuts, bread, cereal, fruit and the most delicious pastries - we were able to eat at the terrace outside overlooking the lagoon. Tea & coffee in the bar was complimentary in the afternoon & very welcome. The staff were polite & helpful from start to finish, easily the best hotel I've stayed at by a very long stretch!

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spreadthelove
Reviews.Content: Even though we had a average room position wise, it was decorated tastefully in traditional style- no complaints but no "wow" about it either. Comfortable, clean and professional. Location pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Very friendly staff with a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Morris-jmmm
Reviews.Content: As we arrived from our water taxi, I was very impressed with the look of the the htel from the outside. Once in the hotel, the staff were very friendly and the room was just as impressive as the outside. We had a balcony which looked out over the main lagoon which was beautiful! The bathroom was good too and the air conditioning worked very well - which is a must isf you visit Venice in July! Breakfast was good too - lots of selection. The hotel did also have an evening menu, however this was much more expensive than the other restaurants in the area. In terms if location, the hotel is right next to st marks sq' however it is a bit away from the grand canal area. All in all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2 star at best.... the reviews cannot be real, beware, see my pics.”
Reviews.Author: wilso1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Londra for 2 nights, July 10th â€“ 12th, booked two rooms, junior suite & classic room. I had spent a lot of time doing my research on location & getting a hotel with a good view of the canals, only to be very disappointed with Hotel Londra Palace. After checking in we were taking to our junior suite on the first floor, after looking around I asked the young lady are we in the right room as it looks nothing like what is shown on your website, she was hesitant and told me this is all the junior suite that are available. I said to her your website describes and shows a totally different room than what I am in, (see link below) she said she will talk to her manager. After waiting about 20 minutes I decided to go back down to reception to see what was going on, I was told by an older women (who I assume was the manger) it was a junior suite and this is all we have available. I had pointed out to her I have no view of the canal as there is scaffold in front of my window, she quite bluntly told me that is not her fault and that is all we have. I also said I believed a junior suite had two separate rooms with a bed in the separate room for my 70 year old mother to sleep in. From here on she become quite rude and wanted to argue with me about how they are on the fine hotels lists and how a fold out sofa is a bed and quite fine to sleep in, regardless of your age. In the end I could not be bothered and book an additional room for my mother as it was a bit hard all three of us sleeping in the same room with no privacy. The additional room I had paid for had air conditioning that did not cool, they said they would fix it but they didnâ€™t. We spent 2 days in Venice in 40deg heat and treated like lepers by these people just because we questioned them on the room, I could go on forever but donâ€™t want to bore you. Honestly have never seen anything like this in my travels around the world. I have stayed in plenty of hotels around the world and this is not a good hotel. The hallways are plain white and the place looks & feels like a hospital, the lift is a 2 person lift, we decided to walk up stairs as it was scary to ride in. It is just nothing like the reviews or their website. I donâ€™t want people to think I am fussy or being unreasonable, I have attached photos of the room along with their website link below, you be your own judge. I can assure you is this hotel is not 4 star & a long way from a fine hotel, â€œ2 star at bestâ€�, and there is now way possible the hotel management have any hospitality training or management skills. For the money they are asking you can get much better in Venice than the Hotel Londra Palace. The pictures on their website of the junior suites is nothing like what we stayed in, I really doubt very much our room was a junior suiteâ€¦ The breakfast was fair at best, nothing cooked, cereals, juice & fruit and you have to pay for a cappuccino. Please beware of the reviews as you donâ€™t need to read too many to get an idea on what is going on, look at the hotel link and my photos and be your own judge. As for Venice is an amazing place to visit, well worth the trip even in a shabby hotel like Hotel Londra Hospital. http://www.londrapalace.com/rooms_hotel_venice.php

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: kel7579
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon and spent our last three days in Venice. We wandered by the Londra Palace on our first evening in town and spontaneously made a reservation for our last night. What a treat! The lobby is beautiful and the outdoor restaurant area is airy, romantic and cozy. Though our view of the lagoon was blocked due to restoration of the statue that sits in front of it, our last night in Venice was unforgettable. The walk to St. Mark's Square takes about three minutes and the water bus stops are about 40 yards from the front door. The breakfast buffet the next morning was a treat as well. I had cold cuts, cheeses, champagne and bread. My husband had three bowls of cereal. There was something for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “DIDN'T WANT TO LEAVE VENICE AND HOTEL LONDRA PALACE”
Reviews.Author: sherrie15
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Londra had the best Location and what a charming place to stay. Our room was beautitul and overlooked the Grand Canal and the bathroom was awesome. The staff was the best from the front desk clerk to the housekeeper who took very good care of my husand and I. The afternoon tea and coffee with pastries was a wonderful way to end your afternoon around the bar. The bar staff was so friendly and very entertaining the breakfast was Great and enough food to feel an army. I would not hasten to stay again and again. My husband surprised me for my Birthay and what a beautiful treat, Venice and The Hotel Londra was the frosting on the BDay cake, Make sure you have private water taxi from airport to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: meange
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Londra Palace in June as part of a trip combining Venice with the Orient Express for our anniversary and found the hotel to be absolutely perfect. The location is fantastic, 2 minutes walk from St Marks and right on the waters edge overlooking the islands and comings and goings of the boats. The terrace is lovely, it's where we had breakfast everyday. Very tastefully laid little tables overlooking the promenade and water. The breakfast is good, lots of choice and plentiful. Our room was super, very clean, comfortable and with a well stocked mini-bar and nice toiletries in the bathroom. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and polite. The bar is tiny but does some great cocktails which we took out onto the terrace to watch the world go by. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
