Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect - except the cost of food”
Reviews.Author: Bryan1940
Reviews.Content: Right on the Riva del Schiavoni, the Londra Palace is excellently positioned for the central sights and for the vaporetti services. We had a room overlooking the Bacino and had wonderful views of Santa Maria della Salute and San Giorgio Maggiore. Our room was stylish and was beautifully furnished with antiques. The bathroom was excellent. Lounge areas were a little restricted for space but the eating areas were spacious. Breakfast were varied and very good. The main meals were excellent, but - along with the rest of Venice - expensive. For a luxurious and restful hotel in an ideal location, you can't do better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service...didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: googoogirl68
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Londra Palace in early May. We had a suite on the 5th floor with a terrace that had a fantastic view of the Lagoon. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed the superb service of the bar staff. Wonderful Bellini's! The concierge arranged a private boat to take us to Murano and Burano, where we were treated like VIPs. Overall, it was a great experience that I would love to repeat again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Londra Palace - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: garethmT
Reviews.Content: When visiting Venice you want to be in the old city where the action is happening. You also don't want to be in some obscure hotel which takes you 3 hours to find trudging up and down stairs and bridges with your luggage. You've probably heard some of the Venetian horror stories of trying to navigate around tight little streets badly marked and numbered. You just don't need that. Londra Palace is on the Grand Canal, visible from the water. Suggest you do as we did and get a Water Taxi transfer to and from the airport. Google online and you'll find a few options - we used Viator and it was great, all worked very well. Airport to the front of the hotel in 15mins. Londra Palance is perfectly located a very short stroll to St Mark's square and becomes your base camp as you explore those easy to reach and very cool sights close by; then as you get more used to Venice and using water buses etc, you venture further out but its always so easy to navigate back to St Marks square and Londra Palace is right there. We stayed in a Deluxe Room with Lagoon view and it was fantastic. Large, spacious, beautifully decked out. I loved everything about the room - the bathroom was especially nice which I always think is an important factor. The staff were professional and courteous the whole time. The manager at reception showed us up to the room and personally explained the amenities of the room, the hotel and workings of breakfast which was a nice touch. Breakfast was brilliantly served in the room and patio on the ground floor in front of the hotel looking towards the Grand Canal. The staff were all very pleasant, warm, welcoming, friendly and helpful. The front desk helped us with making some dinner reservations, pointing out a few must-see things including opening times and dates etc. and giving us a map. I would absolutely recommend Hotel Londra Palace to anyone - in fact I've already done just that to friends going to Venice shortly. You won't go wrong with Londra Palace.

Reviews.Title: “A UNIQUE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: BOUGHTON1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful week staying in a Junior Suite with a lagoon view at The Londra Palace Hotel which whilst officially graded with 4 Stars is significantly better than most 5 Star establishments we have stayed in throughout the World. The room was luxurious and comfortable, the views were to die for, the service impeccable throughout the hotel with friendly helpful staff, and our two evening meals in the hotel restaurant were by far and away the best of the week. The hotel's position is brilliant, close but not too close to St Marks Square, adjacent to the ACTV public ferry jetties, right on the fascinating Riva Degli Schiavoni with its colourful stalls and street traders, and a view across the St Markks Basin to San Giorgio Maggiore and beyond. Within an hour of arriving at the hotel we were able to look out of our bedroom window and watch The Pope pass very close-by on the Papal launch on his way to St Marks Square.....now you don't get that at every hotel! Can't recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “The price was much too high!”
Reviews.Author: SusanM3
Reviews.Content: For $330 Euros a night (roughly $475 US) I expected something along the lines of a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons. We didn't pay for the canal view and perhaps those rooms are more highly upgraded, but the room I was shown to was run down with scratches on the doors, walls and furniture, a bathroom that was old and dingy and decor that was quite depressing. I was so let down, I called down to the front desk right away and said that the room looked nothing like the photos and website and did they have something nicer available. The staff, always incredibly nice and friendly, gave us a second room that was much nicer. The bathroom had been renovated and the decor was much nicer. But it still wasn't worth the price, in my opinion. That being said, the location was fantastic, the staff superb, the breakfast wonderful and we had an incredible trip.

Reviews.Title: “Londra luxury”
Reviews.Author: MEC001
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a perfect location. Great help and practical advise from Alvitse and Aldo on the front desk - both worthy of their Golden Key status. The room was very well appointed and the bathroom stylish, ours had a great view of a campanile and dome. The bedding was of very fine linen and wonderfully comfortable. During your visit make sure you ask to be taken up to the roof top viewing platform which offers a spectacular view over the whole of Venice. This would make a perfect and private special location to toast your visit.Â  No review would be complete without mentioning the amazing breakfast buffet. Fresh, delicious, gourmet breakfast Â topped off by a freshly made espresso was a perfect indulgent start to the day which easily ruled out the need for lunch and perfect fuel for the hours of walking the maze of tiny streets.Â  Being just metres from the San Zaccaria vaparetto stop made transfers very easy. The public ferry from the airport stops at the door given you a scenic entry via Murano. We were leaving by train and once again the vaparetto left from San Zaccaria to the station. One tip is to buy the 24 hour tourist ticket â‚¬18 allowing time to do the islands and the trip to the station.Â

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: StaffordshireJulie
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed here last year for a girls weekend away.It is a fantastic hotel beautifully appointed and modern with fantastic views of the lagoon.The breakfasts were great with ample choice of food .i would recommend this hotel to everyone young and old its brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: andyvandin
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our time at the Palace. Located right near St Marks, the views are spectacular from the rooms, the bathroom big enough for a tired traveller and the room extremely comfortable. Drinks each night down on the board walk as the city rushes by and finally dinner on the last night was just superb

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great view, great location!”
Reviews.Author: MTHerts
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at the Londra Palace, what a great few days. Our room was a deluxe lagoon view on the 1st floor with 2 lovely port hole windows. We were worried it might be noisy as it was just above the street but it was really quiet, we didn't even hear any noise from other rooms. The beds were comfy, rooms spotless and the towels big and fluffy. Lovely buffet breakfast which we ate every morning outside on the terrace whilst people watching! The staff were friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The location is perfect, 2 minutes walk from st Mark's Square and right across from the ferry and boat stops. Recommend the Waiting for Tchaikovsky package which included dinner in the restaurant. Final icing on the cake was the 'Happy hour tea' served every afternoon where you could have tea or coffee and biscuits which was included in the room rate. A great hotel for half the price of the Danielli!

Reviews.Title: “So chic in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Rodolphe
Reviews.Content: Decor is a mix of Venitian style with contemporary elements in a perfect harmony. Room verry comfortable, staff speaks fluent English and French, my room Nbr 310 had a great view on the water and the isle across. Dining room quite beautiful and dinner was really delicious, I had this enormous Clubsandwich, my neighbouring tables had nicely presented pasta and fishplatters. Free WiFi in rooms. Bathroomamenities nice but could be of better quality. Breakfast amazing. Concierge very helpful and professional. Special thanks to Manager Alain who was extremely caring. Rolf, MB, Paris

Reviews.Title: “Luxury embedded in history just steps away from everything Venetian.”
Reviews.Author: elmo1123
Reviews.Content: Tchaikowsky slept and wrote his music here. Only 53 rooms and/or suites. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Italian Style”
Reviews.Author: italytraveller099
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely 4 night stay here.,and we were glad we chose it. The position is wonderful,5 mins from St Marks Sq and on a wide waterfront with views of the canal ,lagoon and churches,handy for boat stops.The busy waterfront quietens down in the evening. We were warmly welcomed by the staff and noticed that there appeared to be many returning guests who were treated like old friends,always a good sign. The room,Junior Suite was decorated in classical italian style,damasks on the walls and crisp white bedlinen, towels changed twice daily. The lobby,dining room ,lounge were in a more modern fresh style but in keeping with the hotel building. Breakfast was good, fresh baked sweet and savoury pastries,bread,yoghurts, cereals,fresh fruit salad,hams and cheeses,all you would want really. We slept quite well, no noise from other rooms . The restaurant meal was again very good and staff attentive. Although Venice in general is very expensive ,If I were to visit again I would choose the Londra Palace for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK!!!”
Reviews.Author: javier1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but I'm afraid unless you get a good deal you just get what you pay for!!! I used to stay at Metropole but this was a special occasion and wanted a treat, booked two deluxe rooms with lagoon view at 336 Euros room per night & not very impressed!!! Staff are nice (particularly Alessandra Bognolo, kind and professional) and others not nice. Rooms a bit faded - see pics. Apparently hotel was full so not a single advantage of being member of SLH Club (never before), neither room upgrade, late checkout or any other courtesy even if I mentioned that was a special occasion & asked... Huge lack of details!!! Great location but not impressed with breakfast or hovering & cleaning common areas when come back from dinners - night-cups in the Danieli then... Nice terrace - best spritz - but Monaco, Bauer & Gritti's much better location & service. Overall disappointed & next time perhaps back to Metropole or any other small quaint hotel with price tag justifiable!!!

Reviews.Title: “excelent Hotel, excelent service”
Reviews.Author: ezini
Reviews.Content: It is a nice Hotel The service is incredible The staff is always in good mood The breakfast and free tee is nice

Reviews.Title: “A Room with Beautiful Terrace”
Reviews.Author: Traveller201188
Reviews.Content: Spacious junior suite with a terrace with stunning view. Very helpful reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: briansarahgray
Reviews.Content: took my wife here for her 40th birthday.fantastic hotel ,food was gorgeous,staff were very friendly,and the views were amazing,ideal location,people really friendly,dont always believe when you read negative comments try it out for yourself this hotel is a must,love to go back again one day .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room”
Reviews.Author: forestAndorra
Reviews.Content: Booked through, bookings .com after reading the reviews on their site and here on trip adviser, went for my wife's birthday for a couple of days. We had a city view room although you could not see the city being on the first floor ! That said the room was perfect, recently refurbished, no english channels on the wall mounted tv,it was soon resolved. The room had a small terrace so great for a cigarette, the bathroom excellent. We ate in the restaurant first night, expensive, but ok. The hotel recommended osteria oliva nera, go there, fabulous food and service.

Reviews.Title: “SPLENDID. AWESOME. LONDRA. VENICE”
Reviews.Author: BJ_INT
Reviews.Content: Londra Palace is one of the best hotels in this magnificent city of Venice. We stayed at a spacious Junior Suite on our Valentine`s trip and everything was just magical. We have two little gorgeous balconies - one to the the room and one to the bathroom. The last one is overlooking the old city and the other one is overlooking the Venice Lagoon, and it was very nice to wake up and the first thing you see is the gondolas, San Marco Bell and the other picturesque views. The service was perfect and the breakfast - wonderfull. The location is just the best - a few steps to St. Marc Square. The hotel is a little pricy, but... the memories is priceless, right...

Reviews.Title: “Truly fabulous”
Reviews.Author: soulsjs
Reviews.Content: This was my ninth visit to Venice. My last stay was at the Danielli, which I loved, but this hotel is really fabulous and a lot cheaper. We booked through citalia who offer a free night and a free lunch. The room was beautiful and I can honestly say that the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel. The bathroom was warm and clean and the towels were beautifully fluffy. The staff were all very polite and helpful with no hint of condescension Breakfast was the usual Italian buffet with excellent coffee. You just can't fault the position. You even get complimentary tea or coffee in the afternoon. This was my first visit to Venice in February; what a wonderful time to visit! The city is almost peaceful (before Carnivale, of course!). When I return to Venice I will definitely stay at the Londra Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “In the City of Love”
Reviews.Author: lizard4444
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel in the city known for love, this five star hotel is centrally located and offers vacationers all the very best including complimentary wi-fi so you can stay in touch back home. The daily breakfast is amazing and the views are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “great location, service ok”
Reviews.Author: zpl666
Reviews.Content: Londra Palace is all about location. Rooms are nice, clean and bright. Breakfast is very tasty. Service is just ok, people at the reception not extremely happy to see us arriving in the evening but probably just my impression. Serving staff could not help with the windows shutters and during breakfast I had to order twice my cappuccino. Having said that the hotel is great, just 2 minutes walking from San Marco. Recommended but it comes at a price. I was looking for something great for my engagement week-end but I have to say that the hotel interiors are not special in any way, just normal I would say. Amazing view from the room balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Probably one of the best hotels in Venice, Italy”
Reviews.Author: medship
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Londra Palace many times and we always stay in the same room. Beautiful, very italian, spotless with a friendly staff. A true home away from home. Recommended to anyone. Expensive but well worth the price in our view.

Reviews.Title: “venice perfection”
Reviews.Author: stevejtenmen
Reviews.Content: absolute class from arriving to departing-this hotel is possibly in the best location in venice...along with the other three or four hotels lucky enough to be on the water front....book a' lagoon' view room and be stunned by the magnificent views and gigantic cruise ships going past your windows....all water transport is right outside the hotel-so if you feel adventuress its really easy..... st marks square-rialto bridge-loads of bars and shops to browse are only two minutes away.......when you return at the end of the day the hotel staff and service are brilliant..........go up the 'bell tower' in st marks square for views of venice that will stay with you forever........quality hotel..superb location..fabulous staff.....fantastic short break...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Chezza1962
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Fabulous location only a few minutes walk from Piazza San Marco, with vaporetto service just steps from the front door. Lovely room tastefully decorated, good sized marble bathroom. Gorgeous restaurant with chandeliers overlooking the water, where we enjoyed breakfast each day. Breakfast very nice with excellent pastries and cappucinos! Staff very helpful and friendly. Could not fault this hotel in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: likecity
Reviews.Content: I was suggested this hotel, and would affectionately suggest it to any person travelling to Venice. Not possibly one of the most well known hotels here, it is regardless one of the nicest I have ever resided in. We resided throughout the acrid freezing of January, and our room was unfailingly moderately hot and welcoming, while the every day morning meal (included in the rate) was a large increase to kick-start the forenoon sightseeing. Fantastic position, intimate sufficient to seem exceptional, and attractively adorned all through - you would not proceed incorrect residing at the Londra Palace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for luxury, try the Londra”
Reviews.Author: pag125
Reviews.Content: Prosecco upon arrival, umbrellas and boots available for the wet weather, cappucino mid afternoon, gracious staff, central location, fresh flowers in the room, Guests are truly pampered here.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel in the Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: tommyd55_dallas
Reviews.Content: The Londra Palace is an great hotel and the pictures online don't do it justice. We had an amazing time and everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly. Nicola at the front desk was especially charming and helpful giving us perfect restaurant choices and always welcoming us by name and quickly taking care of every need and question we had. The service staff at the restaurant and the bar were all much nicer than many of the other places we visited and made us feel right at home. The hotel is located in the heart of the Lagoon walkway and minutes from everything we needed in San Marco and around the island. The Water Taxi, Gondola and Water bus locations were steps away from the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel ... in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: peters97
Reviews.Content: The Londra Palace is a great hotel with exceptional service. I would stay there again on my next trip to beautiful Venice. From the moment we checked in we were greeted and treated like valued guests. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. The large marble bathroom was immaculate and had a large window . The buffet breakfast was adequate and the cappuccinos excellent! The free wi-fi was a very nice surprise ... ask for it at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Edgingin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just two "blocks" away from Pza San Marco - close enough to walk, far enough not to be among continuous crowds. Some have complained about noise on the busy street below, we didn't notice this at all despite two sets of French doors opening towards the front of the hotel. Our Deluxe room was not enormous but I loved the way they balanced the feeling of typical Venetian decor with modern updates. The view was amazing. The staff were very helpful. Rooftop terrace a lovely place to bring a drink and watch the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Old Venice charm with a great view of the lagoon”
Reviews.Author: petrus47
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite similar to others nearby although the staff was more than helpful even though the Wifi quality varies from room to room and I was moved to a Jr.Suite. The view from the main restaurant is somewhat blocked by a large statue but the food and service were excellent by any standard.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service and location.”
Reviews.Author: Cheshire7
Reviews.Content: We were recommended The Londra Palace by friends. The service level we received from all the staff was truly excellent, discrete and unobtrusive. The food and service in the restaurant and bar were first class. Front desk were very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The suite we had was lovely with views overlooking S Giorgio - worth every Euro to wake up to views like that. Location is truly superb allowing easy and quick access to all the major attractions. Water taxis right in front of the hotel providing great value. You think it would be noisy but The Londra Palace provides a haven of peace and tranquility after the bustle of Venice, a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: GraceW852
Reviews.Content: staff were very attentive and great service throughout. Room facing the canal was splendid w/ the San Gorgio Island right infront of us. Rooms were a bit small but is to be expected with such an old building. We will definitely stay there again when we visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingPea
Reviews.Content: As an impromptu decision we went to Venice during our honeymoon and stayed there. We had a room facing the Grand Canal which was amazing. The hotel is perfectly located just few steps from Saint Marc Square ! And everyone was really helpful pointing us to local restaurants and other charming things in Venice !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel & Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: travelpeg_65
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my fabulous 2 week Italian vacation. We started in Venice and stayed at Londra Palace which is in a great location and easy to get to by water taxi from the airport. Our room faced the water and the main walkway below. We were afraid it would be noisy at night with all the people outside, but it was never a problem. We were even able to nap during the day with lots of husle & bustle below....the room was quiet with the windows closed. We loved sitting on the window sill watching all the people below. We also enjoyed sitting on the terrace eating breakfast each morning watching the cruise ships go by. We ate at the hotel restaurant, Do Leoni, which was really good and not as expensive as we thought it would be (well, compared to everything else in Italy). Housekeeping was also very prompt every day so we never had to return to an unclean room. Overall, a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone should stay here once in their life.”
Reviews.Author: Armonk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in March. The hotel is in a prime location with superb views of St Mark's Basin and San Giorgio Maggiore. And it is within 5 minutes of St. Mark's Square and one minute from a prime vaporetti stops. So it is also a very busy location with much pedestrian and boat traffic and concomitant noise, most of which is not objectionable but it can affect your sleeping if you have a room that faces that way and leave the window open at night. Closed, the windows keep things pretty quiet. The views are so exceptional that I believe the noise was worth it but everyone should make their own choice. The staff was excellent. Very helpful and friendly. Every member of the staff was charming. The rooms are done very luxuriously. Ours had 11 foot ceilings (the hotel is composed of three formerly private houses conjoined and has been run as a hotel since the 1880s). The beds are highest quality, from the mattresses to the coverings. The room was adequately sized, neither too large nor too small. I would note however that it is stated to be a junior suite and other rooms may be smaller. It was not what in the US we refer to as a suite in that there was only one room with a sitting area. In the US, ""suite" generally means a sitting room and a sleeping room that are separate rooms with a door between them. The bathroom was also adequately sized. The shower pressure was strong, which was much appreciated although the drain was slow. There is a buffet breakfast included with the room that was quite ample. The hotel restaurant was quite excellent and I have reviewed that separately. Room service is available with a children's menu as well. I hope this is helpful. While the hotel is expensive, I think everyone should have the chance once in their life to wake up and look out at the sunrise or sunset on San Giorgio Maggiore. It was a sublime experience.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay in a splendid hotel!”
Reviews.Author: veno
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a great deal at the Londra Palace through our travel agent otherwise is a bit pricey but then what isn't in Venice and I think we would still have been delighted even paying full price. The hotel is extremely well located, looking over the Grand Canal and at most a 5-minute walk to St Marks. We also found it easily accessible from the airport via the Water Bus service that stopped right outside the hotel (San Zaccaria) for 13 euros each. As you would expect there is also a plethora of good restaurants at varying prices within a short walk. We opted for the cheaper city facing room, which was extremely well appointed in particular including a lovely bathroom. The bed and bedding were fantastic, perfect for sleeping off all the food and wine! The buffet breakfast was included in our price (24 euros pp otherwise) and was good quality with fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, meats, cheeses, coffee and tea included. Hot options were also available but at extra cost. Other than breakfast we didnâ€™t make much use of the restaurant but did try the cheese selection one night which was nice and the drinks in the bar seemed comparable to prices elsewhere. All in all we really enjoyed our time at the Londra Palace, the staff and service were all fantastic, and would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!!! Is this beautiful or what????”
Reviews.Author: NaniSantaF
Reviews.Content: We went on a family trip to Venice and were very lucky in staying at this hotel at a convenient winter rate! Our rooms were very neat and had a stunning view over the bay, not to mention the perfect location, close to everything . The manager was also very kind to us and let a bottle of Prosecco waiting for us along with a warm and welcoming note. Bathrooms were confortable and offered every extras to pamper the guests!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Stay - What a view!!”
Reviews.Author: misheshi
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at Londra Palace after being pampered on a two week luxury line cruise. I have to say that the pampering continued. Fabulous service, attentive staff and a beautiful room! I stayed in the suite with a wide balcony and truly enjoyed sitting in the chairs watching all the ships go by as well as watching the tourists on the promenade below. Sunsets were amazing and the location was perfect. Another treat is the outside dining area, where you can relax and people watch while enjoying a cocktail before dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money”
Reviews.Author: Australia1959
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Londra Palace Hotel for four nights. It was not value for money, very expensive and poor quality breakfast offered (cheap croissants and cotton wool rolls and none of the lovely italian bread we expected) Lunch for example Â£9 for an omelette and Â£3.50 for a small cup of coffee. My bathroom had mould growing around the shower. We got a turn down service on the first night and then they did not bother. On the whole tired and dated and could do with some money spending on the rooms. The only plus points were that it was on the front a few minutes walk from St Marks and the Vaporetto stops.

Reviews.Title: “This is the one for us!”
Reviews.Author: Leo516
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in various hotels in Venice which were very good but Londra Palace is now THE one for us. From booking early in the year with most helpful staff (Fabiana and Alessandra) to being greeted by a wonderful concierge who helped enormously and then entering into a suite which was absolutely to our taste. Faultless staff who are all approachable both in the hotel and the restaurant. Bright and airy seating area which some hotels don't have. Continental breakfast is good but if you want something other than what's on offer, then there's a menu to select from. It's our favourite location - opposite San Georgio with Salute to your right. We'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Londra Palace”
Reviews.Author: Traveller016
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late at the Londra Palace so had something light to eat and then headed off to bed. We both woke very earlier with a great feeling of anticipation for when we pulled back the shutters there was the most fantastic sunrise and our view from our window was just out of this world. We felt like kings and queens.We had very high expectations about the Londra palace but these were certainly met and on occasions exceeded along the way. We had a meal on the terrace on the second night which was really memorable with great food, wine and very friendly service. There was a great buzz arond the restaurant as there was a bollywood film being made on the square and the actors were staying here so it was fun doing a little people watching. Venice is the most amazing place we enjoyed every moment of our weekend. I would have no hesitation of recommending the Londra Palace

Reviews.Title: “My Venice Wedding was perfect because of the Londra Palace.”
Reviews.Author: sweetchariot
Reviews.Content: I booked my Venetian wedding through Kuoni and stayed at the Londra Palace for 7 nights. The hotel upgraded our room from a classic room to a deluxe room with a view of the lagoon. It was fantastic. The staff were brillant and nothing was too much trouble. We where married on 6th August 2009 (we walked through St Marks and everyone clapped). Five mintues later we arrived at Do' Leoni, which is the restaurant attacted to the Hotel. It was perfect for a wedding reception, everything is cream and white and beautiful and the outside dining area was surrounded by flowers. We had a 5 course meal with red and white wine (as much as we wanted) plus bottled water for 75 euros a head, for 17 guest. The meal was the best of the whole trip and my wedding cake was also included in the price. This Hotel made my wedding. Book with them and you will not be disappointed (and I am a glass half empty person!) I even got a going away present. We will be going back....soon.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: REDBEARDBristol
Reviews.Content: hotel clean and position good , close to saint Marcos square. on arrival porter failed to even offer to help carry my wife's luggage to our room. breakfast very disappointing for the money,very very basic , and staff in no hurry to serve you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningTraveler99
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Londra Palace. We arrived after a long international flight to our lovely, quiet rooms which looked out over the rooftops of Venice. We slept wonderfully and were able to recover from jet lag in our very comfortable rooms with very nice bathrooms. My only suggestion to the hotel would be to upgrade the bed linens as they are a bit scratchy. The location is superb--just down from St. Mark's--and it is wonderful to walk everywhere from the hotel. The concierge was top-notch. He gave us fantastic restaurant suggestions and was extremely helpful during our stay. The breakfast was delicious and it was nice to be able to sit out on the deck overlooking the canal when the weather was clear. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Beautiful Hotel, great room, icing on the cake!”
Reviews.Author: travelinpair83
Reviews.Content: If you want an incredible view with a beautiful and roomy place to relax after a day in Venice, then Room 510 at the Londra Palace is for you! This room had a terrace with two lounge chairs and a small table and chairs that overlooked the Grand Canal. We would come back from a day of exploring the islands of Venice and relax with a cocktail under the afternoon sun with the cool breezes off the water massaging away any tiredness. Awesome! It is expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location & Views”
Reviews.Author: TonyLon
Reviews.Content: So long as you get a room overlooking the water I dont think this hotel can be faulted. The staff are very welcoming and even the buffet breakfast (taken on the terrace at teh front watching the crowds pass by) is perefectly adequate. And it withing walking distance of St Mark's Square with a vaparetto stop only 2 minutes away. Expensive, but worth it for a special occasion

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but don't eat here.”
Reviews.Author: conradbaines
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great and mine was overlooking the Grand Canal!!!!!! I loved the hotel for that, but don't eat at the restaurant the food was gross. Eat in one of the many amazing restaurants in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: karijude
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming and helpful staff, tasteful and comfortable and sizeable accommodation with good bathroom and beautiful views of Guidecca and San Georgio

Reviews.Title: “Tchaikovsky should've been the last guest”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkLuxtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Londra Palace in April 2009 with my husband, and at first glance, it seems pretty nice. The location was good, very near to the water taxis, and the lobby and restaurant seems to have been updated recently. After that, I was pretty disappointed. The elevators, hallways, and rooms were old and outdated. Our room was so small, and felt claustrophobic. You could not sit on the toilet without first closing a door and squeezing in; my husband has long legs, so it made it especially uncomfortable. Ok, one more plus, the concierge was helpful. He did recommend a great restaurant, a little pricey, but non-touristy with good food (Da Franz). Also, the servers at the free breakfast buffet were rude. They offered breads, cheeses, cereals, some cured meats, bagels, juice and coffee. All hot items, eggs, etc were extra and A LOT extra! If you weren't ordering from the hot list, they seemed inattentive and rude. I would not stay here again and should've taken my friend's suggestion and stayed at the Bauer. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels in venice”
Reviews.Author: JLove2512
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Londra Palace is one of those hotels that cannot be overrated. No matter what you think you might experience when booking this hotel, you'll be impressed. I stayed in this hotel with my daughter for her graduation present and it was absolutely amazing. From the welcome champagne, chocolate covered strawberries in the room to the spacious room, awesome breakfast and lovely staff, we couldnt have asked for more. The price was WELL WORTH IT and this is the best way to spend a vacation in Venice. One of the, if not THE, most amazing hotel we stayed in. the staff was so nice and the location could not be better!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Awesome Suite”
Reviews.Author: mattencolin
Reviews.Content: As you can read by the title I've been at Londra Palace in a wonderful suite at the 5th floor, but having seen some of the other rooms, I'm assure all the hotel is at the same standard. My room number was number 508, it has 2 windows on the same side (south facing) with a stunning view on San Giorgio church and Giudecca island. The room is small to be a suite but if you consider where you are it's pretty big and cosy. The bathroom is made all in pink marble has a big bath and shower. The service is excellent, every time you leave the room the housekeeping clean and tidy up everything and prepare the bed for the night. Cleanliness is absolutely flawless. There nothing to improve in a such classy Hotel. I can't say anything about the restaurant I had only breakfast and it was in line with the rest of the hotel, superb. One thing you have to absolutely try is having a Spritz (a typical Venetian cocktail) in the veranda looking the people walking, the canal and San Giorgio church. It's the best way to taste the real Venice I can assure that Londra Palace with its rooms, its service, its location is one of the best 3 Hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: newlondon1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Londra Palace as we started a vacation in Italy. We loved the location right on the lagoon, with a vaparetto station and gondola stand right there. The activity was frenetic which we loved watching from our balcony. The hotel was excellent. The staff, from the front desk to the dining room were friendly, efficient and had a good knowledge of English. We had one dinner in the dining room, delicious but not cheap. The breakfast buffet was outstanding and eggs were readily available. Our room was a junior suite which we did not consider good value. It was definitely on the small side for 500+ euros and the bathroom was only ok. All in all though we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel when you are ready to splurge. Well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: MyGypsyTravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 3 friends (3 of the 4 of us are travel agents) and found it to be an overall great visit. My first impression of the property was excellent -- it's right on the Grand Canal and has a vaporetto (the water buses that offer public transportation in Venice) stop right in front of the hotel. The lobby is beautiful and tasteful and a good size, so that even if it's busy there is plenty of room for everyone. The staff at the front desk were incredibly helpful and polite. The one bellhop quickly carried our bags to our 2 rooms. He seemed to be the only one on staff and he worked incredibly hard. Overall the number of staff seemed sufficient. The maid service was fabulous -- every time we left the room they came in and did something - cleaned, brought more pillows, etc.. They knew when we were gone because each time we went out, we left the HUGE room key at the front desk. One note about the hotel entrance is that it is up 3-4 steps, with no visible option for those with disabilities. The same is true of the very small elevator, which does not look large enough to fit a wheelchair (there is standing room for 2 people comfortably, 3-4 in tight circumstances). The lack of accessibility is true of the city overall, so when counting this against the hotel, consider the overall situation in Venice. There are bridges over each of the canals that wind through the city and each requires the use of steps, with no ramps. The sidwalks throughout the city are old cobblestone and not well suited for wheels on a wheelchair or a walker. There is only one dining room in the hotel, but it was clean and roomy and the food was wonderful. We enjoyed our breakfast there each morning and the service was very good - attentive but not intrusive -- and they were very tolerant of my desire to practice my limited Italian skills. The breakfast is by buffet (a wondeful buffet with far more then fruit and cheese, which are the common choices on Italian breakfast buffets). And we were able to order eggs from the kitchen for a very reasonable price. The location of the hotel is wonderful. While it is a 15 minute vaporetto (bus) ride from the train station, it sits only minutes (and an easy walk) from St. Mark's square with other shops and restaurants near the square. It's also an easy 20 minute stroll from the hotel to the Rialto bridge, which is full of shops and restaurants. Something worth noting is that we often returned to our hotel late in the evening after strolling through the tiny streets of Venice after dinner. We were a group of women and felt very safe even late at night. The hotel room was nice overall. I stayed in a Jr. Suite and it was roomy and offered a fabulous view of the grand canal full of people and boats (Venice's "Cars") and vendors and tourists. The biggest difference from it and the larger suite is the balcony size. On the Jr. Suite the balcony is very small, standing room only. On the larger suite, the balcony was large enough for some chairs so you could sit and enjoy the view. The only downside to the room the bathroom. It was roomy enough by europen standards, but it was very musty and everytime the shower is used the bathroom floor floods with water because of the lack of a screen for the bath/shower. This is common in Europe and after enough time there, you learn to shower with care. :o) Overall I give this hotel a very good rating. The staff was helpful, able to offer recommendations and information as we needed it. There was a computer in the lobby for use by guests and a beautiful sitting area with free newspapers. The guest rooms are lovely and offer stunning views of the Grand Canal. We paid 360Euro per night for the junior suite, which was a special rate. I'd recommend you ask for any such rates when you book. It was well worth that amount and I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a luxury experience while they explore the amazing city of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights of romance”
Reviews.Author: SydneyOztraveller
Reviews.Content: We have just had two magic days in Venice. They were made very special by the high standards at the Londra Palace. All staff were a delight and attended to all our requirements. Room was very large, very clean and well appointed. The position of the hotel is fantastic overlooking the Lagoon. Ask the Concierge desk for restaurant advice, they know their stuff. We will return

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bhawknine
Reviews.Content: Great Location, driver, five iron from St. Marks Square. Water vapporetto from airport or #2 stops in front of hotel. Pleasant staff, nice breakfast, only negative were rooms were a tad on the small side, otherwise great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Judy10
Reviews.Content: Cannot rate this hotel too highly. The situation is magnificent right on the San Marco Canal with fantastic views. Try and get a balcony room - ours came complete with it's own flag pole. Great place to sit and watch the world go by (and most of the world did)! The food was excellent and the staff extremely helpful - yes it's pricey but what in Venice isn't.

Reviews.Title: “A recommendation worth listening to”
Reviews.Author: FiveHoppers
Reviews.Content: I searched for hours on TripAdvisor and other sites for the right place to stay in Venice for our 20th wedding anniversary. I wanted something special and personal - not one of the corporate like hotels with more conference room facilities than tourist facilities. My brother said that when he was in Venice he often stopped off at the Londra Palace for a cocktail as he walked along the promenade and vowed that he would stay there if he returned. So I booked it. We arrived by water taxi from the airport (an experience in it self and something one must do rather than take the public water bus). From the front, the hotel is not particularly impressive. Indeed, once inside, it is just simple chic, though clean, tidy and welcoming. Our room was on the 1st floor overlooking the lagoon (314). I guess the room (being a mini suite) was about 4 meters wide and 10 meters long, split into a bedroom area and a seating area with a cavernous bathroom and separate dressing area. A floor to ceiling window opened out onto a balcony that is not big enough to sit on but allows one to lean out and admire the view. Our friends (who came with us as one of them had lived and studied art in Venice and so knew her way around better than most tour guides) had a smaller room at the back (300) overlooking the city roof-tops, which was almost as perfect a view as ours. Breakfast at the hotel was had on the pavement veranda overlooking the promenade. Service was attentive. Breakfast was simple continental breads, fruit, cakes, meat and cheese but ample and more importantly fresh. We had dinner at the hotel on one occasion. The menu looks relatively expensive (as is everything in Venice) but when the bill was added up, it was only marginally more expensive than some of the less polished restaurants we went to. The food was excellent. The service was very professional - attentive but not intrusive. We felt special! The concierge was brilliant, advising us where to go, phoning restaurants to make bookings and having our keys ready when we returned without us having to say the room number. All the staff were pleasant and professional. The room rate is high but not as high as many of the other first class hotels. I understand that the rooms either face the lagoon or the city, not the brick wall of another building. If you pay for a junior suite, you get a view of the lagoon. If you pay for a standard room, you get a view of the city. No worries about whether youâ€™ll get what you expect. The Londra Palace is a four star hotel, but I could not think of anything that a five star hotel would have to offer and that we needed. Everything was first class! Some reviews have commented on how noisy the rooms at the front are. They are right. The noise of the water busses is louder than lorries and is continuous. However, with the windows closed, it was quiet. With the windows open, it is the noise of Venice, which adds to the character. For us, the noise was of no concern at all. I will return â€“ maybe on our 25th Anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get much better than this!”
Reviews.Author: EWKSeattle
Reviews.Content: The Londra Palace is a first class hotel in an amazing location on the Grand Canal. It's just steps from St Marks, and is also convenient to the main vaporetto stops. Our adjoining rooms were a nice size and had a view over the Grand Canal. The furnishings are perhaps getting a little threadbare in a few places, but overall, the rooms were both elegant and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was excellent, and the lobby bar is also a nice place to relax after touring. The front desk staff were very friendly, professional and helpful. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location & Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: luxuryholidayqueen
Reviews.Content: Jus come back from a 3 night stay in Venice. As it was a special occassion and our first time away with no kids, we did a lot of research into which hotel we should stay at - looked at the top hotels (Cipriani, Il Bauer etc) and felt that the Londra Palace and inparticular ROOM 510 (which is the one with the LARGE TERRACE and lady sitting on it on their website) was the place to stay. In terms of location, I think it is arguably one of the best situated in Venice - just around the corner from the Grand Canal and a stones throw from San Marco. The Vaporetto stops right outside and also nice and quiet in the evenings. The dining room (we only had breakfast here) was very elegant and tastefully decorated, the staff were very friendly and helpful. Room 510 is the best there is - if you want to sit out on the large terrace (rare in Venice!) and see everything happening then this is the place. We nipped out to the local supermarket and brought our own bottle of wine back with some nibbles and thoroughly enjoyed sitting out there on a sunny afternoon. For an extra 10 euros per person, we also had breakfast served in our room. The room itself was spacious and the bathroom was fine. Towels were beautifully soft and everything was immaculately clean. In terms of restaurants - definatley recommend the Oliva Nera (Black Olive). Easy to find once you know how - ask at the desk!. Good authentic Italian food with wonderful tastes, although not cheap (but nothing is in Venice). Definately worth giving the Londra Palace a try.!

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: tomaso38
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 4 nights at Hotel Londra which is supurbly situated for the main sights in Venice, a wonderful view and great transport connexions. The quality and condition of the decor is first rate; better in my view than some of the other top class hotels I inspected in Venice which seem to rely too much on their names and can look a little tired. The rooms are all different, have wonderful fabrics and colour schemes, beautiful bathrooms and delightful linen sheets. The food and room service is great and the public areas very tasteful and serene. My only slight complaint was slight over-zealousness on certain room service charges and a slightly official attitude by one or two staff. But overall it is difficult to fault the quality of the product and I really cannot think of another hotel in Venice which matches the experience, at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: AreAnyNamesNotTaken
Reviews.Content: For those that have looked at the website for this hotel, it is worth pointing out that it comprises not only the rather drab-looking building that bears its name, but also the more elegant premises next door with the 3 impressive balconies looking out to San Giorgio, the Giudecca and across the lagoon. We were in room 208 in this building, which benefits from the balcony on the left of the 3, as you face the hotel. The room is fairly small, but certainly adequate for our purposes, and decorated in a manner best described as "sumptuous", comprising an antique bureau, fabric wall coverings and a high, frescoed ceiling. Aside from a small stain on the carpet, it was immaculate. Being on the waterfront, close to bus stops and St Mark's Square, there is a certain amount of round-the-clock noise that the double-glazing cannot completely eliminate. However, apart from the early morning honking of the ferry to Burano, we did not find the noise intrusive. The only negative was the rather crappy little TV, but with views this compelling, who needs telly? What really stood out for me about Londra Palace was that, in a city where employees of the service industries have raised unsmiling rudeness to an art form (when was the last time anyone saw a Venetian waiter crack a smile?), most of the staff were friendly and charming, and keen to do whatever they could to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The only real downside to this hotel is its restaurant. While the front of house do their best for you, they cannot make up for the lack of skill in the kitchen. We "enjoyed" mushily overcooked asparagus, followed by pasta so tooth-breakingly under-cooked as to redefine "al dente" altogether and then desserts from a 1970s-style sweet trolley that had been standing around the bar for goodness knows how long (perhaps since the 1970s). As a consequence of the poor food, the restaurant was virtually deserted, making it also entirely devoid of any atmosphere. A shame really, as the dining room and terrace are very nicely appointed, and showed so much promise.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: TB21
Reviews.Content: Certainly not cheap but a fantastic hotel and great location. Lovely room and huge bathroom. Helpful staff and a great breakfast buffet! Definitely recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JustHavingFun048
Reviews.Content: You cannot get a better location then the Londra Palace. Located just a couple hundred meters from St. Marks and right next to the vaparetto stop. Small but nice lobby. Very good concierge. Tiny elevator. The views from the room are spectacular. Although you are on a busy promenade, the rooms are quiet and, of course, there are no cars in Venice. Our room was very well appointed. Bed was particularly comfortable. The bathroom was mid sized, but covered in marble and very nice. It that weird shower thing you get in Europe sometimes where there is no shower curtain, but a piece of glass that comes one-third the way across from the wall. We soaked the floor the first day. Had a nice breakfast at the hotel, but I recmnd venturing out for other meals. Only complaint was funky air conditioner. One day we were freezing cold, next day too hot. Although the hotel was very responsive they never quite got it fixed. For $700 per night I expect perfection. Overall a very nice hotel, but you have to shut your eyes when paying the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: JD4321
Reviews.Content: The londra Palace has the most perfect location facing the lagoon, yet isn't as massively expensive as some of the other water-front hotels. Close to St Mark's square and most other attractions. Our room was very Venetian, very opulent. Venetian hot chocolate is 'to die for'. Give Murano a miss unless you like high pressure selling and have a few hours to be trapped in their sales rooms. The glass-blowing exhibition was good as was looking at the glass itmes on offer but not worth it for the pressure exerted on you to buy something.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed the Londra Palace!”
Reviews.Author: MaxandLola
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, and we had no complaints. Great location, with a nice open feeling. We were upgraded to a junior suite on the fifth floor overlooking the lagoon. The only unusal thing about our stay was the bath tub, --you could not stand in it because of the angled ceiling. That did not mar our stay, though we did get the bath area very wet. Very comfortable classic furnishings and bedding. Breakfast buffet was our only meal eaten at the hotel and was fine, nothing spectacular. If you can afford the price you can't go wrong at this luxury property, and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TourTime71
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Londra Palace. The staff is great and were very helpful with obtaining water taxi to airport, restaurant reservations, a ride to Morano and any questions we had. The rooms were large and lovely and we looked over a beautiful courtyard. The location is excellent on the Grand Canal and so easy to access when you arrive by ship. It is within walking distance of all sites and a few steps away from St. Mark's Square. The hotel also provided a very nice Continental Breakfast. We would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “What a knock out”
Reviews.Author: Doowah
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel, it was a wonderful place to stay. Great location, elegant and confortable rooms, excellent restaurant, and a staff full of charm, friendliness and helpfullness. We will not hesitate to stay there agin in the future, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The best room & view in Venice”
Reviews.Author: FredandOllie
Reviews.Content: We arrived by train from Florence having had an awful experience at the Helvetia&Bristol, so we were not in the mood to take any prisoners. When we were shown to our suite, room 510, what a beautiful room and terrace. Everyone at the hotel was helpful and attentive, the food was great both breakfast and dinner, plus the recommendations of the concierge for restaurants to eat out were perfect. BUT to be able to retreat to our terrace and look over the Grand Canal and the view towards St Marks Sq with a cool drink after all the hustle, queues and people was truly superb. We have travelled a lot and this has got to be one of the best value hotel rooms I have ever stayed in, absolutely magical.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TechnoPimp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on our first trip to Venice. We arrived by train and it was convenient that this property was directly across from a water taxi stop. We saw several other tourist struggling with bags weedling through some narrow streets and warrens of Venice. Hotel was nice, impeccably decorated and helpful staff. Our room was not a canal view but did have a delightful view of the a courtyard plaza. Keep in mind its a smaller hotel so rooms book up quickly. Nice location easy to get around. They will also arrange for a trip to Murano with a glass maker that will pick you up by vaporretto and and whisk you off to Murano for glass making tour. Nice but HIGH PRESSURE sells pitch at end. They make you feel like they did something just for you and then lead you around a showrooms of what you could buy. IF you can avoid the sells pitch it was a great tour and trip . Glass there is good but very pricey compared to more touristy(cheaper) stuff any where else. So if you are not a collector I would pass. Also we heard this section of Venice can flood during the winter but we had no problems however it was pretty chilly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Fife_Flyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for our wedding. Due to a mix up regarding my request for a balcony room during booking (my fault) we were allocated a junior suite on the 5th floor which is the attic floor with dormer windows overlooking the lagoon. On any other occasion this would have been more than acceptible as it was spacious and well appointed. I spoke to reception staff who were able to change our room to a suite on the 3rd floor (314) with balcony. All fixtures and fittings worked perfectly although the shower did spray out beyond the screen but hey, thats what towels are for! Breakfast was slightly dissapointing in terms of the variety available with cooked items available at extra charge. Can't comment on other dining services as we didn't eat in the hotel. A previous reviewer made mention of thin walls - however I couldn't say our room was blighted with this as no noise from adjoining rooms was apparent. Staff were pleasant, attentive and nothing seemed too much trouble. They even managed to give us the use of another room for the guys to change in on morning of wedding. Like the honeymooners, we received a complementary bottle of bubbly and also received a gift from the hotel in the form of a glass/gold medalion when we checked out, which was a nice touch. Worth the money if coming to Venice for a special occasion. Word of caution about the balcony. Nice to sit out with a glass of wine of an evening but beware of the anti-pidgeon electric wire running round the outside of the ballustrade. I slipped my (bare) foot through the columns and got zapped!

Reviews.Title: “An ok place”
Reviews.Author: midwestern_wanderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights on my first ever trip to Venice in early May. I did a lot of research on Tripadvisor before making my decision. I figured the Londra was a good choice as it's not as hideously expensive as some of the others, but still of high class. I booked a 'suite with balcony' on the hotel's website thinking it would have a view of the Grand Canal and be on a high enough floor to not be too noisy. When arriving in Venice, we dropped off the rental car and took a water taxi to the hotel - a very lovely ride through the city to the front of the Hotel on the Grand Canal. We were checked-in quickly and courteously and taken to what turned out to be The Tchaikovsky suite on the first floor facing the Grand Canal. While this is a very lovely room, it is very noisy as you can much talk to anyone on the street from your window, and did not have a balcony. When I called the front desk to say I had booked a suite with a balcony, they said that I did not specifically state that I wanted a balcony in my reservation and had nothing available. They did offer to switch our room the second night, but we're not fond of packing up and moving again just for a night, so we stayed put. I have a theory that they made this room on the first floor the 'unique' Tchaikovsky suite as they figured no one would want to stay in it otherwise due to the noise. The room was decorated quite nicely and the small tribute to the composer was nice as I am a piano player myself. The bed was only slightly more comfortable than sleeping on wood and reminded me of a mattress that has been passed down a few generations. The marble bathroom was decent, but would flood every time you took a shower as there is only a small glass slab attached to the wall to keep any water in. Aside from the room, the front desk was helpful in giving us directions, booking our gondola ride (totally overrated and expensive at 110 Euro after dusk), and getting our water taxi to the airport. I also suggest not asking them for recommendations on where to eat, but rather walking the tiny streets and finding one on your own - but be aware that all restaurants will be sweeping their floors by 10pm. I also wouldn't recommend eating in the hotel restaurant. We had lunch there one day and was nothing more than average - you can find better places walking around. The hotel breakfast is also not much more than cereals and cheap pastries. We also found it difficult to get any attention from the wait staff the two times we sat out on the patio. The Londra Palace is an ok hotel in a great location just steps from St. Markâ€™s Square, but because there are so many other choices in the city, I would be more than keen to try something different the next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Londra Palace”
Reviews.Author: JakeandMay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Londra Palace for three nights in late July to kick off our honeymoon. This was the perfect place to start our holiday in Italy. The location was outstanding, five minutes maximum walk to St Mark's Square and other attractions were very close by. The water taxi journey from the airport to the hotel was a fantastic introduction to Venice and there is a water taxi stop right in front of the Londra Palace. The room was stunning, ask for a lagoon view as we could look out on S.Giorgio Maggiore and Santa Maria della Salute from our mini-balcony. Even though we were at the front of the hotel, it was very peaceful and quiet in the room. Breakfast was a high point as it was served on a picturesque terrace in front of the hotel. There was a buffet breakfast with plenty of choice (salami, cheese, croissants, fruit etc). We did not have an evening meal in the hotel as we wanted to explore Venice, two recommendations are Cantinone Storico in Dorsduro and Acquapazza in the Campo St'Angelo. We found that the staff were excellent and as we were on honeymoon there were freebies (ie. a bottle of Prosecco on arrival). Overall we would highly recommend the Londra Palace for a relaxing stay and a hotel convenient for all the main sites.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not great...”
Reviews.Author: PierreSydney
Reviews.Content: We were very excited about staying at Londra as we had read many glowing reviews on trip advisor and that it was a member of the Small Luxury Hotels of the World group. First off, I must say that the location of this hotel is fantastic and I would consider staying here again for that reason. However there were a few low points/ average experiences had whilst staying here. One experience was when we decided to have a drink at the bar one afternoon, after ordering drinks we requested an ashtray...three times...and it still was not provided. We then noticed that other patrons were provided with complimentary snacks with their drinks It was only after we placed our room key on the table when we started to get some reasonable service. One another day, I requested an iron of which I was informed that they did not have any irons! Although the hotel was reasonably clean the bathroom was very grotty, the back of the bathroom door was full of hair stuck with condensation from previous guests...yuk! Further, you can here toilets flush and showers running all timesof the day and night- very thin walls!! Staff in general are not very attentive, as you would expect for the price you are paying-in particular one time an employee at breakfast started to clean up our table before we had finished and grunted when we said that we were still eating. In summary, if you are staying here for the location you will not be disappointed...however if you are expecting any more you may be questioning if there is a better hotel to stay. One another note, for those who have not been to Venice before we recommend that you spend the extra money and get a water taxi to the hotel and not the water bus. The water bus from the airport was a terrible experience...you feel like you are catlle being transported to the meat market. A water taxi is expensive but makes for a much more pleasent start to your holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cbtren05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Londra Palace May 11-13th. We had one of the cheaper rooms on the back of the property, but the room was great. The bathroom was very modern and comfortable. The only bad thing was the bed was very hard, but this was easy to overlook with all the other great features! The staff was very helpful and attentive. Breakfast is great- all sorts of cereals, fresh fruits, meats, breads and cheeses. The location is fantastic- right on the grand canal and a block from St. Mark's. We really enjoyed sitting on the patio with bellinis and watching both the boats in the canal and the people strolling the boulevard. We also ate dinner at the hotel and the food was wonderful - the pumpkin risotto was amazing! Another nice feature is the water bus drops you off almost at the front door of this property so you don't have to wander around the streets of Venice with your luggage looking for your hotel! We loved this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again on future trips to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay after some debate”
Reviews.Author: badger108
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to Venice. With the help of our travel agent we had booked ajoining rooms over looking the lagoon. Unfortunately, we were shown to small rooms on back side of hotel. After some debate with the sharp, insensitive, woman manager we acquired the rooms we had reserved through our travel agent. The male conceirge was wonderful, helpful and professional and made exceptional reservations for our evening and luncheon meals. Because our plane reservations were very early, he arranged for a bag breakfast and a water taxi to the airport. The Londra to convenient and comfortable; but because of the episode with the woman manager and the disrespectful way we were trearted, the Gritti Palace will be our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeffJBloomington
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at this hotel...6 nights...so consider this when you read other reviews. We had two rooms overlooking the lagoon. They were wonderful.The rooms were about 20 by 20 with excellent bathrooms added...The walls were covered with fabric and the floors had carpet. Room 102 had a beautiful view of the lagoon and St. Georgio. We had wine and other munchies before leaving for each meal. Our first night, we ate at the hotel restaurant. It was as good as any of the other wonderful meals we had that week. Every afternoon, we had a class of wine with munchies in the bar. The setting was perfect, watching the activity outside as people walked toward the San Marco... On the 5th floor, you can take pictures and sit and sip a glass of wine when the weather permits. We got some great pictures as the sun was setting... The rooms are comfortable, with fabric covering the walls and carpet covering the floors...The bathrooms are spacious by Europe standards, with towel heaters, and other additions. The maid service is excellent. We had to leave early our last day and a water taxi was ready to take us to the airport. The hotel obviously has swing... We've stayed at Relais and Chateux all over Europe, and this was a great hotel. Our time in Venice included a half day with a guide and six wonderful dinners...Ristorante Do Leoni at the hotel; Firsch Toscana; Al Covo; Corte Sconte; Da Fiore; and Oiva Nera. I will try to write reviews of these great places in another spot on this website.

Reviews.Title: “Bella”
Reviews.Author: KittyHopper
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, overlooking the lagoon, beautiful food, beautiful bed linen, beautiful place. The staff are lovely, the Bellini's are the best (though they'd run out of peach so mine was with kiwi - just as nice). The Doge's Palace is next door but four (very near) and the No 1 & 82 vaperettos stop pretty much outside the door (so do the gondolas). Just book it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Junior suite”
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for a kid free weekend in Mar 07; two night 'Tchaikovsky' deal in a Junior suite (510) with terrace facing up the Grand Canal. Superb, special and homely room. Although it is difficult to forget how much cash you are spending the deal against standard rates for a Junior suite was pretty good. Mostly this was due to the Tchaikovsky tasting menu meal that was included. See the menu on their website it was 9 courses and both my wife and I thought every one was delicious, never been so impressed by 'hotel' food. Service was attentive but not invasive. Minor issues: not everything in our room worked; they missed our welcome drinks until prompted; the complimentary papers were never seen; the special gift (we assume) was a somewhat drearly and badly translated tale relating to the composers stay in the hotel. Expected a better bar (small and looked like an afterthought) had read reviews in guide books of the jazz nights at the hotel but this doesn't start till May. Staff were good, gave you as much as you needed, location excellent. Tips: take the water taxi from the airport, costs around 100 euro with tips and a great way for you/ your party to arrive in style. We were lucky with the weather but I expect Venice is a bit of a nightmare in the rain so avoid if you can. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Londra Palace -- Unparalleled Service!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeFarris
Reviews.Content: While there maybe properties that are better known, or even older, the historic Londra Palace sets the standard by which other hotels are judged. Situated on the Grand Canal, and a short stroll from Piazza San Marco and its famous basilica, a better location cannot be found. The management team led by Mauro Zanotti seamlessly advises its clientele on all matters of culture and interest in Venice -- from the legendary Harry's Bar to how to shop for Murano glass, to where to obtain concert tickets to many of Venice's renowned musical presentations. With some angst they even warn of the pickpockets which can be legion in Venice. Speaking of which, Hotel Londra Palace was home to Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky while he composed three of four movements of his "Fourth Symphony." Guestroom 106 contains photos and memorabilia honoring the composer. There is little doubt the present management has maintained the warm ambiance and service which was available to Pyotr Ilyich while updating the technology to the internet age. I should mention their in-house restaurant, Do Leoni, replete with Venetian specialties, is superb, and by Venetian standards moderately priced. Don't shortchange yourself, save at least one night to dine at Do Leoni!

Reviews.Title: “Venice in February..wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: mackiernan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Londra Palace for four nights in early February and found the LP to be all we'd hoped for on our first trip to Venice. The room was pretty, spacious with lots of storage. Good bathroom...remember "C" on the shower faucet means "caliente", not "cold". We had three large windows overlooking the harbor, with lovely views of Sta Maria della Salute and the souvenier booths...I could imagine this could get noisy in summer.(We were on the second floor). The sheets were crisply pressed linen, changed every day, and there were light weight throws, for a quick nap, in the closet. Breakfast was very good, everything one would want. We enjoyed blood oragne juice and prosecco every morning! Venice in February is great; cold but dry and sunny, with no crowds. We never waited in line at a museum or vaporreto stop, and last minute dinner reservations (by the concierge)were a snap. I do recommend booking in the morning for dinner that night, small,popular places do fill up, even in February. All in all we would recommend the Laundra Palace highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: therap4paws
Reviews.Content: We were in Italy staying with family and decided to take a last minute side trip by ourselves to Venice. Got on the computer and went straight to TripAdvisor for some ideas about hotels. The reviews were very good for this hotel and the price was right so we booked it. We got there and were so pleased! The rooms are not huge but no where in Italy are you going to find "huge" rooms. Great flat screen Tv in the room. The bathroom was marble, beautiful, great shower. Luxurious linens, etc. Concierge was fantastic and the location was perfect! Would definatley stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Exclusive & Splendid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lyana
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night on the 17th Dec. 2006. We were travelling in group of 4 and so we booked two standard room from the hotel website which cost us just 185 Euro per nite. When checking in, we were very fortunate to be upgraded for one room which overlooking the Lagoon. The view was fantastic!! The hotel itself is in great and beautiful location.Here is what we love:- LOCATION Splendid! Infront of the lagoon. 5 min. walk to Piazza San Marco which is the centre of shopping and restaurants ROOM Every room is unique in its decorations. Full of wallpaper and antique furniture. There are no 2 room with similar decorations. The deco is beautiful, romantic and very elegant. The room size is big enough for a Europe hotel. Very spacious. Love the bathroom - its full of marbles and beautiful deco STAFF Staff is very helpful and friendly. Speak very fluent English Breakfast comes with the room - although it is just a simple Italian breakfast with breads, cereal & pastries Will definitely stay here again next time!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineMT
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at the Londra Palace Hotel and loved every minute of it. Unlike our experience in other parts of Italy, the hotel staff could not have been more friendly and helpful - always cheerful and apparently glad to see us! We stayed in a junior suite, complete with balcony and flag-pole - a complete treat as we had booked it only for the third night trying to save our pennies but had been up-graded because the hotel was full. The only down-side was fog-horns outside the window at 5 a.m. in the morning on one occasion, but this was a small price to pay for having such a fabulous view. All credit to the concierges, bar staff and restaurant staff who did their best to make our trip as memorable as it was.

Reviews.Title: “Fanatastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bertie21
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice and as I booked due to this web site I thought I should do my bit and write a review! Our experiance of the hotel was without fault. We had a junior suite over looking the lagoon with a terrace. I would definately recommend booking a terrace than a balcony room, it was lovely any time of day or night to have drinks on the terrace and the view is just wonderful. Suite 416 was not large, bathroom quite small but we thought it was perfect and the large terrace more than made up for the size of the room. Bed was big and comfortable. The hotel also arranged for a private boat for five hours, although not cheap 420 euros, it meant we could hop from Island to Island as we wanted - and get away from the crowds! One thing to be aware of the buffett breakfast does not include anything cooked this costs another 20 euros each! My husband has just peeked over my shoulder and said that I have to mention that the hot chocolate from the hotel is simply mmmmmmmmmmm!! If you stay here I hope you have just as good a time as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: blessedtravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a brief stay in Venice where we were fortunate enough to stay at this marvelous facility. The room was absolutely perfect, the bathroom sumptuous, and every possible need anticipated. The concierges, especially Walter and Alvise, were incredibly helpful with directions, recommendations, and reservations for dinner, even assisting my husband to find a pharmacy when one was unexpectedly needed. We would always chose to stay here over other places we visited in Venice. It is within walking distance of everything and a 45 minute vapparetto ride from the train station. The service was extraordinary and discreet, and the room was quiet and beautifully decorated. Linda Dwyer, Ct. USA

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & 5-star Service”
Reviews.Author: Carly&Shaun
Reviews.Content: Hotel Londra is in a perfect location on the water near St Mark's square, however being summer - venice was extremely busy with tourists so we escaped down the lane aways in the opposite direction to st mark's square! The hotel has a lot of old charm about it. We definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views of lagoon”
Reviews.Author: CathS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Londra Palace for two nights to celebrate my birthday and had booked a room with a lagoon view. The room was slightly on the small side, but the view over the lagoon was fantastic. Next time, I'd book a room with a balcony as we spent a lot of time hanging out of the window to take in the view!! The hotel staff were very knowledgable and gave us an excellent recommendation for a restaurant on the night of my birthday -di Forni. They also helped with booking taxis, etc. Breakfast on the hotel terrace was a nice experience and the bar is small but well stocked. The location of the hotel is excellent being just a stone's thrown from San Marco. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fit our bill”
Reviews.Author: Remydog
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to Venice many times, and though the Londra was not cheap it proved to be one of best values we've experienced in Venice. We were a group with diverse needs and the Londra served us perfectly. We travelled with our young children and my elderly mother, and the hotel accommodated all our needs. We arrived very early in the day, yet two of our three rooms were immediately available, providing much needed freshening for all of us. My mother was given a junior suite with a view of the lagoon. Since she needed to take full advantage of the mid-day break, the balcony and view allowed her to rest while enjoying the bustle of Venice. We had connnecting rooms with our kids; we were in a junior suite on the lagoon and our kids in a connecting room with views over the of a square and roofs of Venice.
