It felt more like an apartment than a hotel room. When our kids needed a break, they could retire there while we enjoyed our room. A few quick comments: - It's in a very convenient (e.g. to S. Marco and Vaporetti) and busy location, but noise was never an issue. The front rooms were like a vault when closed for the evening. - Breakfast was a broad selection in a lovely location. - Venetian hotel staff are not the warmest Italians you will meet, but they did more than we asked without question. They were not put our by having kids in the hotel and provided much assistance to my mother. - Bathrooms, linens, etc. were what you would expect of the highest N American standards. In short, we expected an extraordinary amount from the hotel and in no way were we disappointed. I can't say, in our earlier visits to Venice, this was the case. I'm sure there may be similar or even cheaper hotels with these things to offer, but I have no complaints spending time at the Londra.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected - well done Londra Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dollart
Reviews.Content: Having earlier on our trip stayed in Florence at a so-called' 5* deluxe hotel and been very disappointed, naturally we were left concerened about our accommodation on arriving in Venice. We need not have worried as the Londra Palace excelled in every respect. We had a junior suite with balcony (recommended) which was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was adequate, the staff were extremely courteous and helpful. I would heartily recommend the Londra Palace and endorse the earlier comments made by other guests. Well done the Londra Palace.

Reviews.Title: “hotel londra - fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Amazing room - very large double, with more than ample space for a single bed for our daughter. Loved the sik walls and marble bathroom. Stunning lagoon view. Excellent service, great breakfast. Right next to st marks square. Would recommend this hotel, although not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: nearywaldron
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that the Londra Palace is a bit pricey, and if you are paying in dollars, it is very bad at present due to the exchange rate. Nonetheless, the location is excellent, less than 5 minutes' walk from St Mark's Square, and compared with many other hotels in the vicinity, it is pretty good value. If you are going to stay here, go for a room with a view - it is stupendous. It has a fabulous restaurant with excellent service: the maitre d', Michele, does a fantastic banana flambe at the table. We found the staff and service faultless, and definitely plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and professional”
Reviews.Author: Graham B
Reviews.Content: Londra Palace is situated at the start of the Grand Canal, very close to the Doges Palace and San Marco Square - a great location with views across the lagoon to San Giorgio Maggiore and Santa Maria. We had two rooms; a junior suite and a deluxe double. Both were well appointed, very comfortable, very clean and the ensuite bathrooms were finished in marble . Each room overlooked the lagoon. The junior suite had a balcony which was perfect for people and boat watching. The staff were friendly and professional. We used the concierge to book restaurants and make travel arrangements to Murano etc. The restaurant staff were equally attentive and friendly. We ate breakfast in the hotel dining room which extended onto a pavement terrace, weather permitting. Breakfast was traditional continental fare - more than ample and very relaxed - delicious fresh fruits, pastries, meats and cheeses. Lunch on the terrace was a great way to watch the world go by. The restaurant recommendations were good with one exception. We had excellent meals at Da Franz and Corte Sconta. Both are seafood only with no menus - you have to listen carefully to the Maitre d ! The locations are a little off the beaten track but worth the effort and the food was superb. The exception was Do Forni - you are quickly led through the first attractive dining room to less impressive 'back rooms'. You are packed in like the proverbial sardine, the waiters are preoccupied with getting you out as quickly as possible to seat the next sitting and the food is at best only average. So, 'Don't Forni'. All in all we had a great break. I did not see or experience any of the negative comments of an earlier reviewer and would not hesitate to recommend Londra Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband booked the Landa Palace as a romantic birthday weekend for me, so I had no idea what to expect and had never been to Venice. We were met at the airport by a courteous driver who took us by road across the bridge to a waiting water taxi and then on via the canals to the hotel. This made a for stressless start to the weekend and gave me an insight into Venice. The staff at Londra Palace reception were charming and made us very welcome. We were taken up to our suite. This being the Junior suite on the 5th floor. This pretty suite had beams, three windows, king size bed, a huge jacuzzi bath and spectacular views! On the table was a beautiful flower arrangement and complimentory bottle of 'Champagne' Our 'weekend deal' included dinner which we ate outside on the terrace. This was well presented with a good menu and excellent food. Breakfast was plentiful but could have included eggs and a better selection of cheese and meats. The fresh juice and expresso coffee were excellent. The hotel is well situated for all the tourist attactions and we spend our first evening wondering around the many shops, canals and the amazing Piazza St. Marco. We found the hotel staff very helpful friendly and professional - except the bar tender who could have been more attentive. On Sunday we caught the water taxi straight back to the airport. A fast ride across the lagoon ! In all a wonderful weekend made special by the Landra Palace. I would recommend this hotel to those who like small hotels without too many frills and just want to chill out for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ruggiero
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the Londra Palace, and this is our first choice in Venice! We would definitely return there. It is beautiful from outside, a nice white palace, with a very nice sitting area (restaurant and also only for drinks) outside facing the lagoon - beautiful and so romantic in the evening! We had a room overlooking venice , a very nice decorated room, spacious, and a really large bath, also the bath with a big window overlooking venice. All comforts, good service, good breakfast, the staff is very friendly and helpful, and the location is great! 5 Minutes to San Marco,(great in the evening) 5-10 Minutes walk to Rialto and the Accademia bridge, I saw a room with view to the lagoon - wonderful views, so romantic - really a beautiful designed hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I made our reservations, the Hotel Londra Palace was in the TripAdvisor top 5 of Venice hotels. I am not surprised at all that is now #18 (it should be lower.) After spending 3 fantastic nights at the JK Place in Florence (highly recommend that hotel), we were very disappointed when we saw our room at the Londra Palace given the price of the Lagoon View Room. The carpets were worn and the bedspread and drapes looked like they had been in use since 1974. The only positive thing I can say is that the lagoon view was amazing, but that credit goes to Venice, not the hotel. I agree with other reviewers who said that the front desk staff do not go the extra mile in any way. We couldn't wait to check out. I think you could pay less and be much happier at another hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: voyaginggal
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Hotel Londra Palace in mid-February and truly were content with our hotel choice. Firstly, the location cannot be beat. The hotel is situated along the famous Riva degli Schiavoni and practically directly across from the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop. The hotel is in good company, too; the Danieli is nearby (alas, not what I expected it to be and I was glad we opted for the Londra Palace). For a European hotel, in Italy, in Venice, the Londra Palace was airy and clean, with a cool color palate in the lobby. I booked through the hotel's web site and took advantage of the "Welcome to Venice" package -- which afforded us a double accommodation, overlooking a splendid piazza and old church (with bell tower lightly ringing each hour in the day). Our room was in Venetian decor-style, yet not too ornate and cluttered. Sheets were changed daily, as well as sweet-smelling towels. It provided us with small luxury hotel respite for five nights. The staff at the hotel couldn't have been nicer or more inviting. My mother and I especially enjoyed the staff at the hotel's restaurant Do Leoni, as well as the affable bartender. Venice is not a late night town and it seemed like at eight o'clock, San Marco and the Riva degli Schiavoni cleared for the day. This is when we took advantage of Do Leoni and the hotel's lounge. A lasting memory was sitting at a small table in the lounge with a dessert wine and sublime ice cream and candy creation while watching San Giorgio across the way. Breakfast was included with our package and it was displayed in a lovely manner each day. Albeit nothing incredible in terms of a spread, the service was kind and friendly. Note: The hotel next door, Hotel Savoia, to the hotel has a restaurant called Principessa. It's a great place to sit outside and enjoy the "Cafe Society" life, all the while sipping a delicious orange juice or a hot chocolate. But beware of going inside to the actual restaurant. I am not a complainer and hate when I see fellow Americans expect the world when dining, whether it be in Europe or in the United States. But really, it was just an awful dining experience and the service was so slow. On top of it all, the waiters were quite rude with no action to be rude over. My main concern when traveling is the safety of the hotel's location. You couldn't get any safer than the Londra Palace, even walking along the Riva in the late evening. Venice is gorgeous at night, haunting and mysterious in the morning hours; it was nice to not have to be worried about traveling back to our hotel through small, winding streets. Londra is out in the open, well lit and beckons your arrival after a long day exploring Venice. Two suggestions for Italy holidays: Go to the church of San Vidal to savor Vivaldi music in the evening (daily concerts). It added to the Venetian experience. Also, my mother and I also visted Rome on our trip. One day, we hired Giovanni Garguilo of Tour of Italy to take us to the Amalfi Coast--for the day! (Google him and you'll find his web site.) It was the most perfect day, the most perfect place in the world, and Giovanni is quite, well, unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great!”
Reviews.Author: CB100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Londra Palace as a result of rave reviews on this website and were slightly disappointed. There is nothing wrong with the hotel - our room, although a little small and unbearably hot at night (they don't turn on the AC until April!)was comfortable, clean, well appointed and well decorated, service was good and friendly, breakfast was good by continental standards (no hot food) and there is a reasonable, though small, bar - but the hotel lacked that little bit extra which turns a good hotel into a great one. Having been to the fabulous lobby bar at the Danieli on our one previous trip to Venice, we were determined to stay there on our next visit. However, negative reviews on Tripadvisor convinced us the Danieli was,sadly, yet another faded former Grande Dame trading on it's past reputation a'la New York's Plaza Hotel. We actually paid more for our 'Deluxe Lagoon View Room' at the Londra Palace than we would have done for a standard room at the Danieli. Staying in one of the best rooms at a so called lesser hotel is often a better choice than a standard room at the supposed best place in town. Having still not seen a room at the Danieli, they wouldn't show us one during the evening because 'the hotel is full' (even though it clearly wasn't), we don't know if we made the right decision or not. We believe standard rooms are at the sides of the Danieli and in the more modern buildings so they certainly won't have the great views offered from the Londra Palace's Lagoon View Rooms. In any case,the former's windows look so small you probably can't see much out of them and the rooms must be quite dark! Overall, we liked the Londra Palace but would choose somewhere with more to it next time - although the view and location were perfect. We would strongly consider the Metropole. We had one of our best meals ever at the Michelin-starred Met restaurant and it was only 160 Euros for a set five course menu for two with wine - a bargain in any city but especially Venice! The bar was also excellent and the hotel generally seemed more opulent, spacious and characterful.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Excellent Service, Quality Rooms at The Londra Palace”
Reviews.Author: Manchester_UKMark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Londra Palace from 16th to 20th December 2005. It was a wonderful stay. The hotel staff are extremely helpful, diligent and courteous. We stayed in a Junior Suite which was comfortable, nice and warm and, above all, scrupulously clean. The room contained a firm, comfortable King size bed with crisp white sheets. The heating (which is important for a stay in Venice at this time of year) worked perfectly and was fully adjustable. The generous breakfast at the Londra Palace was fantastic. Fresh tea and coffee with freshly baked pastries. The price also included a (non-cooked) buffet breakfast of fresh fruit, yoghurts, cereals, cakes, pastries, fruit tarts, cold meats and cheeses. In terms of location the Londra Palace is about 200 metres from the Dogeâ€™s Palace and 300 metres from St Markâ€™s Square. Need I say more!! We will certainly be staying at the Londra Palace againâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Londra Palace”
Reviews.Author: Jean-PhilippeB
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay in the Londra Palace from 9 to 11 November. The standard rooms are large and the staff is friendly. The breakfeast buffet could be more copious (no hot meal, no toast, no fresh orange juice)

Reviews.Title: “The romance of Venice”
Reviews.Author: UmaS
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Londra Palace on our recent first trip to Italy. The location was perfect for us - a few minutes' walk to St. Mark's Square, close to several vaporetto stops. Definitely opt for a lagoon view room if you stay there. Ours - a junior suite with tiny balcony and two large windows looking out to the island of San Giorgio Maggiore across the lagoon - was like a little jewel box in shades of pink. Nice bathroom. Despite the hordes of tourists below, it was very quiet. Dinner at Do Leoni, the hotel's restaurant, was quite good - as was our included buffet breakfast - juices, coffee and tea, fruits, cheeses, meats, cereals, yogurt, breads, pastries, cookies. Housekeeping was wonderful - nightly turndown service, and fresh towels a couple of times daily. We found the rest of the staff to be very gracious and helpful. The Londra Palace isn't cheap. But it captures the romance of Venice, and I would return there without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: AnnieRich
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with friends celebrating a 40th birthday. The hotel was wonderful in every way. The staff could not have been more attentive and helpful. On our first night there was terrible rain and so we decided to eat in the hotel restaurant. It was excellent too. Venice is elegant and a place you could return to again and again. When we do we will definitely stay here! Another fabulous place to eat is 'da fiore'. Looks nothing from the outside but the food/ambiance is very special indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MissHappy
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel, the location is ideal , close enough to St Marks Square but just enough distance to enjoy the lagoon right infront of the hotel which is fab. As mentioned in a previous note get a water taxi as it saves you struggling with your luggage over 2 bridges however the airport bus is only a 5 minute walk!! The hotel itself is wonderful, the restaurant is gorgeous, the food and service is superb. Our room overlooked the lagoon which was great especially in the morning watching all the cruise ships arriving. Breakfast outside was great but it was a traditional continential style, there was plenty to eat if you like healthy food everyday but some scrabbled egg would have been lovely with my cheese and ham - just abit pricey! Overall, the room - cleaned twice a day (included a weather forecast card in the evening so you could plan your day ahead), service, and food in the hotel was excellent and looking forward to my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were celebrating our 41st Anniversary and wanted a great experience in Venice -- we had never been there before. We booked the Londra Palace based on reading your reviews. They were absolutely accurate! The hotel has a wonderful location; close to everything. We arrived by water taxi right in front of the hotel. Our room and balcony overlooked the canal -- what a spectacular way to wakeup every morning. The view from the bar and restaurant allow you to watch the world walk by; you could spend hours people watching. The room was great, the people extremely friendly, and the services first class. We would comeback again and again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel...it wont dissapoint. Sitting outside and having a meal in the hotel restaurant was fantastic...the food first class and service. The room 408 was excellant great view of the canal (facing it) If you come to venice and stay here, you must get a water taxi as it drops you off right outside the hotel...20 m walk... The only thing that lets it down is the breakfast...cold meats, biscuits, cake, fruit, cerial, youghurt. A weird combo for the english. You can buy all the good stuff but 6 euros for porridge, 6 euros for sausage, 2.5 euros for an egg (any syle) is outrageuos. Those Hilton and Marriott people have got it so right...if you gonna check out of a hotel do it after a fantastic breakfast...people will be back. The hotel is about 2 mins walk to San Marco (really) I will definatley stay here again, although I would like to try the Daniele (which is next door, although I hear the food and service is not good) It was our honey moon and we were greeted with a bottle of Prosecco. Venice However is rip off city...BEAWARE of restaurants offering a tourist menu...It is possible to eat well and affordably on the Grand Canal in the Rialto Area. I was supprised that a lot of restaraunts did not have a Pizza Kiln...they had electric ovens instead... If you like pizza hae a look in the restaurants first as some sell it in VERY small portions...it looks cheap on the menu then when you get it you know why... Go to 'Pizza de Roberto'...everyone knows it...just ask...very good. Their is a MacDonalds there also...very good...we had a very BAD meal in a restaurant in the same street as MacDonalds ...avoid them all...80 euros for rubbish, everyone was complaining and the service was shocking... Good service in Venice is hard to find... San Marco, we paid 35 euros for two cocktails. they also charge for the band that is paying 4.50 euors per person. Lots of places selling pizza snacks and sandwhiches...very cheaply (including one in San Marco) hope this helps ...

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: liberolibera
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the Londra Palace location, just steps from the quay. The hotel is very elegant with pleasant, well-trained staff. It is a bit pricey and our room was showing its age, but the bathroom was wonderful. We also loved the "free" water taxi. The front desk was very helpful with answers to all our "tourist" questions and great suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GabyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Italy vacation, and my two daughters (one a teenager) LOVED this hotel! The location is UNBEATABLE! My daughters in particular enjoyed being able to go out on their own and buy a gelato (I could watch them from my balcony). The staff was superb, and our room was beautifully appointed. After a full day of walking around Venice, we enjoyed taking a break on our balcony and watching the sites on the Grand Canal. Breakfast was great, where once again, the setting was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “I adore this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rm 106, a junior suite which they upgraded us to, with a small balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. Beautiful furnishings, great bathroom, wonderful service, terrific big breakfasts included. Location couldn't be better, without being overly noisy. Definitely worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Dream City! Dream Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Londra Palace was wonderful......wildly expensive (ok, we didn't take the cheapest room ever), but totally wonderful and totally worth it. For heavensâ€™ sakes....youâ€™re in Venice! Live a little! It's a few doors down from the Doges' Palace, and a short walk from the Bridge of Sighs and San Marco. Large suite on the top floor with silk lined walls, antique furnishings, a huge and fabulously elegant bathroom (Italian plumbing!.....more brass and porcelain nozzles, hoses, spouts and fixtures than I've seen in my life!), big windows overlooking the Vittorio Emmanuel equestrian statue with those pussy cat lions in front, a glorious view of the Salute and Grand Canal (wow...just like in the Bellotto painting!) right by a vaporetto stop, terrific breakfast...... A dream hotel in a dream city!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a fantastic weekend in Venice, the flights given by my mother as a Christmas present. We found great difficulty finding reasonably priced accomodation but which was nice enough for us to celebrate a belated first wedding anniversary travelling for the first time without our 6yr old son. Tripadvisor was most usefull in finding hotels with decent reviews. The Londra Palace was ideally situated a few hundred metres from St. Marks and our room was directly overlooking the Grand Canal. We had a superior double as this was all that was available, but they let us have the room at standard rate for the Sunday night - so worth negotiating. Room was traditionally decorated in plush fabric and bathroom in pink marble although I did find it a shame that in such a beautiful old building that plastic insted of ceramic baths have been installed, and the shower over the bath resulted in a slight flood all over the bathroom floor due to a tiny glass shower door. However the balcony and view made up for it. The greatest disappointment was the breakfast. The only healthy option was the fresh fruit which was delicious, but the cereals, even the museli were all sugar coated with full cream milk. There were cakes, and bread which was rather hard, and the preserves were the most tastless I'd ever had. I did have a boiled egg one morning but was rather dismayed to see that anything hot was an extra supplement !! Venice is a definite must to see. We found out whilst there that we are expecting a baby, so the setting of the Londra Palace was perfect, but very pricey - the 2 nights we stayed cost us 800EUROS !!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Londra Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Riva Degli Schiavoni, 4171, 30122 Venice, Italy
